href="https://www.slideshare.net/slideshow/bluehat-v18-the-hitchhikers-guide-to-north-koreas-malware-galaxy/120613743"><span class="sr-only">BlueHat v18 || The hitchhiker&#x27;s guide to north korea&#x27;s malware galaxy</span></a><div class="slideshow-thumbnail Thumbnail_root__qLW0K SlideshowCard_thumb__86aJk" style="aspect-ratio:1.5;--index:22" data-testid="card-thumbnail"><img class="Thumbnail_thumb__UXO3a Thumbnail_blur__opK6A Thumbnail_cover__1zsIi" alt="BlueHat v18 || The hitchhiker&#x27;s guide to north korea&#x27;s malware galaxy" src="https://cdn.slidesharecdn.com/ss_thumbnails/0927-track3-am-thehitchhikersguidetonorthkoreasmalwaregalaxy-181024214609-thumbnail.jpg?width=560&amp;fit=bounds" loading="lazy"/><img class="Thumbnail_thumb__UXO3a Thumbnail_contain__K6M0d" alt="BlueHat v18 || The hitchhiker&#x27;s guide to north korea&#x27;s malware galaxy" src="https://cdn.slidesharecdn.com/ss_thumbnails/0927-track3-am-thehitchhikersguidetonorthkoreasmalwaregalaxy-181024214609-thumbnail.jpg?width=560&amp;fit=bounds" loading="lazy"/></div><div class="SlideshowCard_content__xh7kV slideshow-card-content"><span class="slideshow-title SlideshowTitle_root__2VccW RailCard_title__Tvfiv ellipsis" style="-webkit-line-clamp:2" data-cy="slideshow-title">BlueHat v18 || The hitchhiker&#x27;s guide to north korea&#x27;s malware galaxy</span><button type="button" class="Button_root__i1yp0 Button_secondary__hHiHI Button_text__ZT_3O Button_small__sqsEx Button_icon__1C4qi save-slideshow-button SaveButton_root__b6zuu" data-testid="button" aria-checked="false" aria-label="Save BlueHat v18 || The hitchhiker&#x27;s guide to north korea&#x27;s malware galaxy for later" role="switch" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":Rbdnla7d6:" popovertarget=":Rbdnla7d6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-Rbdnla7d6"><span class="icon Icon_root__AjZyv" style="--size:24px"><span class="Icon_icon__4zzsG" style="mask-image:url(https://public.slidesharecdn.com/_next/static/media/save.ef1812e2.svg);background-color:currentColor"></span><span class="sr-only"></span></span></button><div class="Tooltip_root__7FS0Y" id=":Rbdnla7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="top" style="position-anchor:--popover-Rbdnla7d6"></div><a class="SlideshowAuthor_root__IkT1_ RailCard_author__JYeYZ slideshow-author ellipsis" data-testid="slideshow-author" data-cy="slideshow-author" href="https://www.slideshare.net/MSbluehat">BlueHat Security Conference</a><div class="slideshow-stats SlideshowStats_root__EQOR1 RailCard_stats__ZvZms"> </div><span aria-hidden="true" class="seo-only">Christiaan F Beek, McAfee
Jay Rosenberg, Intezer Labs

The Lazarus, Silent Chollima, Group 123, Hidden Cobra, DarkSeoul, Blockbuster, Operation Troy, 10 Days of Rain attacks are all believed to originate from North Korea. But how can they be attributed with certainty? And what connection does a DDoS and disk wiping attack from July 4 2009, have with WannaCry, one of the largest cyber-attacks in the history of the cyber-sphere? 

We have conducted a comparative research over more than 10 years of malware and tools being used by North Korean adversaries. The results were intriguing and we will share our discoveries but also hunt tactics during our talk. We discovered new links between campaigns and were able to group malware families towards actor groups and discovere interesting patterns.</span></div></div><div class="" id=":R1nla7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="bottom-start" style="position-anchor:--popover-R1nla7d6"></div><div class="separator Separator_root__70Ime Separator_horizontal__czVEa" style="--color:var(--blue-gray-200);--size:1px" role="separator"></div><div class="RailCard_root__rZUGY RailCard_hasDescription__MjSgf SlideshowCard_root__pD8t4 slideshow-card" aria-describedby="recommended-card-description-23" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":R1ola7d6:" popovertarget=":R1ola7d6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-R1ola7d6"><a class="SlideshowCardLink_root__p8KI7" data-cy="slideshow-card-link" data-testid="slideshow-card-link" href="https://www.slideshare.net/slideshow/bluehat-v18-retpoline-the-antispectre-type-2-mitigation-in-windows/119227043"><span class="sr-only">BlueHat v18 || Retpoline - the anti-spectre (type 2) mitigation in windows</span></a><div class="slideshow-thumbnail Thumbnail_root__qLW0K SlideshowCard_thumb__86aJk" style="aspect-ratio:1.5;--index:23" data-testid="card-thumbnail"><img class="Thumbnail_thumb__UXO3a Thumbnail_blur__opK6A Thumbnail_cover__1zsIi" alt="BlueHat v18 || Retpoline - the anti-spectre (type 2) mitigation in windows" src="https://cdn.slidesharecdn.com/ss_thumbnails/0927-track2-am-retpoline-theanti-spectretype2mitigationinwindows-181012163929-thumbnail.jpg?width=560&amp;fit=bounds" loading="lazy"/><img class="Thumbnail_thumb__UXO3a Thumbnail_contain__K6M0d" alt="BlueHat v18 || Retpoline - the anti-spectre (type 2) mitigation in windows" src="https://cdn.slidesharecdn.com/ss_thumbnails/0927-track2-am-retpoline-theanti-spectretype2mitigationinwindows-181012163929-thumbnail.jpg?width=560&amp;fit=bounds" loading="lazy"/></div><div class="SlideshowCard_content__xh7kV slideshow-card-content"><span class="slideshow-title SlideshowTitle_root__2VccW RailCard_title__Tvfiv ellipsis" style="-webkit-line-clamp:2" data-cy="slideshow-title">BlueHat v18 || Retpoline - the anti-spectre (type 2) mitigation in windows</span><button type="button" class="Button_root__i1yp0 Button_secondary__hHiHI Button_text__ZT_3O Button_small__sqsEx Button_icon__1C4qi save-slideshow-button SaveButton_root__b6zuu" data-testid="button" aria-checked="false" aria-label="Save BlueHat v18 || Retpoline - the anti-spectre (type 2) mitigation in windows for later" role="switch" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":Rbdola7d6:" popovertarget=":Rbdola7d6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-Rbdola7d6"><span class="icon Icon_root__AjZyv" style="--size:24px"><span class="Icon_icon__4zzsG" style="mask-image:url(https://public.slidesharecdn.com/_next/static/media/save.ef1812e2.svg);background-color:currentColor"></span><span class="sr-only"></span></span></button><div class="Tooltip_root__7FS0Y" id=":Rbdola7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="top" style="position-anchor:--popover-Rbdola7d6"></div><a class="SlideshowAuthor_root__IkT1_ RailCard_author__JYeYZ slideshow-author ellipsis" data-testid="slideshow-author" data-cy="slideshow-author" href="https://www.slideshare.net/MSbluehat">BlueHat Security Conference</a><div class="slideshow-stats SlideshowStats_root__EQOR1 RailCard_stats__ZvZms"> </div><span aria-hidden="true" class="seo-only">Andrea Allievi, Microsoft

Spectre and Meltdown CPU have been one of the biggest security problem of the year 2018. Mitigations have already been delivered to the customers by both CPU manufacturers and OS developers. While the mitigations for Spectre type 1 and Meltdown have been successfully delivered, the mitigation for Spectre type 2, Retpoline, has been deferred for various problems. This talk will describe the implementation details of Retpoline in Windows 10 (19H1) and all the problem that we faced while testing it. Designing Retpoline has requested the collaboration of different teams in Microsoft, especially between the Kernel and the Compiler team. This talk will explain how we overcame all the implementation issues and allow all the involved Windows Kernel components to work with Retpoline in a retro-compatible way. At the end we will analyze the performance issues and explain how the Kernel team has found a solution for them</span></div></div><div class="" id=":R1ola7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="bottom-start" style="position-anchor:--popover-R1ola7d6"></div><div class="separator Separator_root__70Ime Separator_horizontal__czVEa" style="--color:var(--blue-gray-200);--size:1px" role="separator"></div><div class="RailCard_root__rZUGY RailCard_hasDescription__MjSgf SlideshowCard_root__pD8t4 slideshow-card" aria-describedby="recommended-card-description-24" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":R1pla7d6:" popovertarget=":R1pla7d6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-R1pla7d6"><a class="SlideshowCardLink_root__p8KI7" data-cy="slideshow-card-link" data-testid="slideshow-card-link" href="https://www.slideshare.net/slideshow/bluehat-v18-memory-resident-implants-code-injection-is-alive-and-well/119226832"><span class="sr-only">BlueHat v18 || Memory resident implants - code injection is alive and well</span></a><div class="slideshow-thumbnail Thumbnail_root__qLW0K SlideshowCard_thumb__86aJk" style="aspect-ratio:1.5;--index:24" data-testid="card-thumbnail"><img class="Thumbnail_thumb__UXO3a Thumbnail_blur__opK6A Thumbnail_cover__1zsIi" alt="BlueHat v18 || Memory resident implants - code injection is alive and well" src="https://cdn.slidesharecdn.com/ss_thumbnails/0926-track2-pm-memoryresidentimplants-codeinjectionisaliveandwell-181012163626-thumbnail.jpg?width=560&amp;fit=bounds" loading="lazy"/><img class="Thumbnail_thumb__UXO3a Thumbnail_contain__K6M0d" alt="BlueHat v18 || Memory resident implants - code injection is alive and well" src="https://cdn.slidesharecdn.com/ss_thumbnails/0926-track2-pm-memoryresidentimplants-codeinjectionisaliveandwell-181012163626-thumbnail.jpg?width=560&amp;fit=bounds" loading="lazy"/></div><div class="SlideshowCard_content__xh7kV slideshow-card-content"><span class="slideshow-title SlideshowTitle_root__2VccW RailCard_title__Tvfiv ellipsis" style="-webkit-line-clamp:2" data-cy="slideshow-title">BlueHat v18 || Memory resident implants - code injection is alive and well</span><button type="button" class="Button_root__i1yp0 Button_secondary__hHiHI Button_text__ZT_3O Button_small__sqsEx Button_icon__1C4qi save-slideshow-button SaveButton_root__b6zuu" data-testid="button" aria-checked="false" aria-label="Save BlueHat v18 || Memory resident implants - code injection is alive and well for later" role="switch" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":Rbdpla7d6:" popovertarget=":Rbdpla7d6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-Rbdpla7d6"><span class="icon Icon_root__AjZyv" style="--size:24px"><span class="Icon_icon__4zzsG" style="mask-image:url(https://public.slidesharecdn.com/_next/static/media/save.ef1812e2.svg);background-color:currentColor"></span><span class="sr-only"></span></span></button><div class="Tooltip_root__7FS0Y" id=":Rbdpla7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="top" style="position-anchor:--popover-Rbdpla7d6"></div><a class="SlideshowAuthor_root__IkT1_ RailCard_author__JYeYZ slideshow-author ellipsis" data-testid="slideshow-author" data-cy="slideshow-author" href="https://www.slideshare.net/MSbluehat">BlueHat Security Conference</a><div class="slideshow-stats SlideshowStats_root__EQOR1 RailCard_stats__ZvZms"> </div><span aria-hidden="true" class="seo-only">Luke Jennings, Countercept

Attackers have been avoiding disk and staying memory resident for over a decade and this has traditionally proven an Achilles heels for security products and the teams that operate them. The boom in both EDR products and memory forensics toolkits in more recent years have helped defenders to fight back but attackers are already adapting their approaches. 

This talk will cover both classic and modern techniques for injecting code into legitimate processes on Microsoft Windows systems, as well as several techniques for detecting them. This will include both system tracing methods, good for proactive detection, as well as memory analysis techniques that have the added benefit of allow detection of pre-existing compromises in real-world incident response scenarios, with a brief case study example. As part of this, practical examples will be given showing how Microsoft’s ATP and Sysmon help in this area as well as other techniques. Finally, the future of this area will be considered, including how the .NET runtime already complicates detection techniques in this area and how this will likely become increasingly challenging as more attackers discover and exploit this.

By the end of the talk, the audience should understand the importance of code injection in the context of memory-resident implants, the key techniques for performing it and detecting it and the challenges of achieving this in the real-world at enterprise scale.</span></div></div><div class="" id=":R1pla7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="bottom-start" style="position-anchor:--popover-R1pla7d6"></div><div class="separator Separator_root__70Ime Separator_horizontal__czVEa" style="--color:var(--blue-gray-200);--size:1px" role="separator"></div><div class="RailCard_root__rZUGY RailCard_hasDescription__MjSgf SlideshowCard_root__pD8t4 slideshow-card" aria-describedby="recommended-card-description-25" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":R1qla7d6:" popovertarget=":R1qla7d6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-R1qla7d6"><a class="SlideshowCardLink_root__p8KI7" data-cy="slideshow-card-link" data-testid="slideshow-card-link" href="https://www.slideshare.net/slideshow/bluehat-v18-massive-scale-usb-device-driver-fuzz-without-device/119226365"><span class="sr-only">BlueHat v18 || Massive scale usb device driver fuzz without device</span></a><div class="slideshow-thumbnail Thumbnail_root__qLW0K SlideshowCard_thumb__86aJk" style="aspect-ratio:1.5;--index:25" data-testid="card-thumbnail"><img class="Thumbnail_thumb__UXO3a Thumbnail_blur__opK6A Thumbnail_cover__1zsIi" alt="BlueHat v18 || Massive scale usb device driver fuzz without device" src="https://cdn.slidesharecdn.com/ss_thumbnails/0927-track1-am-massivescaleusbdevicedriverfuzzwithoutdevice-181012162936-thumbnail.jpg?width=560&amp;fit=bounds" loading="lazy"/><img class="Thumbnail_thumb__UXO3a Thumbnail_contain__K6M0d" alt="BlueHat v18 || Massive scale usb device driver fuzz without device" src="https://cdn.slidesharecdn.com/ss_thumbnails/0927-track1-am-massivescaleusbdevicedriverfuzzwithoutdevice-181012162936-thumbnail.jpg?width=560&amp;fit=bounds" loading="lazy"/></div><div class="SlideshowCard_content__xh7kV slideshow-card-content"><span class="slideshow-title SlideshowTitle_root__2VccW RailCard_title__Tvfiv ellipsis" style="-webkit-line-clamp:2" data-cy="slideshow-title">BlueHat v18 || Massive scale usb device driver fuzz without device</span><button type="button" class="Button_root__i1yp0 Button_secondary__hHiHI Button_text__ZT_3O Button_small__sqsEx Button_icon__1C4qi save-slideshow-button SaveButton_root__b6zuu" data-testid="button" aria-checked="false" aria-label="Save BlueHat v18 || Massive scale usb device driver fuzz without device for later" role="switch" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":Rbdqla7d6:" popovertarget=":Rbdqla7d6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-Rbdqla7d6"><span class="icon Icon_root__AjZyv" style="--size:24px"><span class="Icon_icon__4zzsG" style="mask-image:url(https://public.slidesharecdn.com/_next/static/media/save.ef1812e2.svg);background-color:currentColor"></span><span class="sr-only"></span></span></button><div class="Tooltip_root__7FS0Y" id=":Rbdqla7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="top" style="position-anchor:--popover-Rbdqla7d6"></div><a class="SlideshowAuthor_root__IkT1_ RailCard_author__JYeYZ slideshow-author ellipsis" data-testid="slideshow-author" data-cy="slideshow-author" href="https://www.slideshare.net/MSbluehat">BlueHat Security Conference</a><div class="slideshow-stats SlideshowStats_root__EQOR1 RailCard_stats__ZvZms"> </div><span aria-hidden="true" class="seo-only">Zhuo Ma, Tencent

USB is one of the most common interface supported on modern computer. Modern OSes offer tons of USB drivers to support frequently used USB device classes. For other 3rd party USB device, Microsoft provide automatic driver downloading and installation via Windows AutoUpdate Service. In this talk, we consider this as a novel attacking surface exposed by Windows.

We are trying to assess the vulnerability in those USB drivers provided via Windows AutoUpdate Service, which can be automatic installed and run after device plugged in. Obviously, these drivers are all designed for real USB device, which have to talk to device during running. 

So, the biggest obstacle for assessing these drivers is we can not prepare real USB devices for all of these drivers. To overcome this, We developed a system to emulate these USB device, further, we are trying to fuzz these drivers against our emulated USB device. By using this system, we can fuzz device drivers without the real USB device. In further, we can also precisely fuzz every stage of driver loading. We can feed any custom data to the drivers to trigger vulnerabilities. Also, this system supports IO Control Code fuzz as well. And all in all, all of this progress can be done automatically. 

We tested about 6000 drivers, yielded hundreds of crash by fuzzing. IO Control Fuzz also gave a reasonable result. We are going to divide our talk into three parts: the first part is about how we get the list of automatic installed USB drivers, and how to analyze these drivers in automatic ways; the second part is about the fuzzing system we designed, including the architecture of system, ways to emulating devices, key points for designing; the last part will show some vulnerabilities we found by this system.</span></div></div><div class="" id=":R1qla7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="bottom-start" style="position-anchor:--popover-R1qla7d6"></div><div class="separator Separator_root__70Ime Separator_horizontal__czVEa" style="--color:var(--blue-gray-200);--size:1px" role="separator"></div><div class="RailCard_root__rZUGY RailCard_hasDescription__MjSgf SlideshowCard_root__pD8t4 slideshow-card" aria-describedby="recommended-card-description-26" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":R1rla7d6:" popovertarget=":R1rla7d6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-R1rla7d6"><a class="SlideshowCardLink_root__p8KI7" data-cy="slideshow-card-link" data-testid="slideshow-card-link" href="https://www.slideshare.net/slideshow/bluehat-v18-modern-day-entomology-examining-the-inner-workings-of-the-bug-bazaar/119145473"><span class="sr-only">BlueHat v18 || Modern day entomology - examining the inner workings of the bu...</span></a><div class="slideshow-thumbnail Thumbnail_root__qLW0K SlideshowCard_thumb__86aJk" style="aspect-ratio:1.5;--index:26" data-testid="card-thumbnail"><img class="Thumbnail_thumb__UXO3a Thumbnail_blur__opK6A Thumbnail_cover__1zsIi" alt="BlueHat v18 || Modern day entomology - examining the inner workings of the bu..." src="https://cdn.slidesharecdn.com/ss_thumbnails/0926-track3-pm-moderndayentomology-examiningtheinnerworkingsofthebugbazaar-181011202716-thumbnail.jpg?width=560&amp;fit=bounds" loading="lazy"/><img class="Thumbnail_thumb__UXO3a Thumbnail_contain__K6M0d" alt="BlueHat v18 || Modern day entomology - examining the inner workings of the bu..." src="https://cdn.slidesharecdn.com/ss_thumbnails/0926-track3-pm-moderndayentomology-examiningtheinnerworkingsofthebugbazaar-181011202716-thumbnail.jpg?width=560&amp;fit=bounds" loading="lazy"/></div><div class="SlideshowCard_content__xh7kV slideshow-card-content"><span class="slideshow-title SlideshowTitle_root__2VccW RailCard_title__Tvfiv ellipsis" style="-webkit-line-clamp:2" data-cy="slideshow-title">BlueHat v18 || Modern day entomology - examining the inner workings of the bu...</span><button type="button" class="Button_root__i1yp0 Button_secondary__hHiHI Button_text__ZT_3O Button_small__sqsEx Button_icon__1C4qi save-slideshow-button SaveButton_root__b6zuu" data-testid="button" aria-checked="false" aria-label="Save BlueHat v18 || Modern day entomology - examining the inner workings of the bu... for later" role="switch" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":Rbdrla7d6:" popovertarget=":Rbdrla7d6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-Rbdrla7d6"><span class="icon Icon_root__AjZyv" style="--size:24px"><span class="Icon_icon__4zzsG" style="mask-image:url(https://public.slidesharecdn.com/_next/static/media/save.ef1812e2.svg);background-color:currentColor"></span><span class="sr-only"></span></span></button><div class="Tooltip_root__7FS0Y" id=":Rbdrla7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="top" style="position-anchor:--popover-Rbdrla7d6"></div><a class="SlideshowAuthor_root__IkT1_ RailCard_author__JYeYZ slideshow-author ellipsis" data-testid="slideshow-author" data-cy="slideshow-author" href="https://www.slideshare.net/MSbluehat">BlueHat Security Conference</a><div class="slideshow-stats SlideshowStats_root__EQOR1 RailCard_stats__ZvZms"> </div><span aria-hidden="true" class="seo-only">The document discusses the modern zero-day exploit market and economy. It describes how vulnerabilities are found by researchers and sold through brokers to various parties, including governments, criminals, and exploit kit creators. It also outlines trends in the market, such as the impact of new mitigations, regulations, and events like Pwn2Own on the sale of exploits. Finally, it shares some examples of vulnerabilities the Zero Day Initiative has helped patch and the conclusion encourages questions.</span></div></div><div class="" id=":R1rla7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="bottom-start" style="position-anchor:--popover-R1rla7d6"></div><div class="separator Separator_root__70Ime Separator_horizontal__czVEa" style="--color:var(--blue-gray-200);--size:1px" role="separator"></div><div class="RailCard_root__rZUGY RailCard_hasDescription__MjSgf SlideshowCard_root__pD8t4 slideshow-card" aria-describedby="recommended-card-description-27" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":R1sla7d6:" popovertarget=":R1sla7d6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-R1sla7d6"><a class="SlideshowCardLink_root__p8KI7" data-cy="slideshow-card-link" data-testid="slideshow-card-link" href="https://www.slideshare.net/slideshow/bluehat-v18-the-matrix-has-you-protecting-linux-using-deception/119144744"><span class="sr-only">BlueHat v18 || The matrix has you - protecting linux using deception</span></a><div class="slideshow-thumbnail Thumbnail_root__qLW0K SlideshowCard_thumb__86aJk" style="aspect-ratio:1.5;--index:27" data-testid="card-thumbnail"><img class="Thumbnail_thumb__UXO3a Thumbnail_blur__opK6A Thumbnail_cover__1zsIi" alt="BlueHat v18 || The matrix has you - protecting linux using deception" src="https://cdn.slidesharecdn.com/ss_thumbnails/0927-track2-pm-thematrixhasyou-protectinglinuxusingdeception-181011201719-thumbnail.jpg?width=560&amp;fit=bounds" loading="lazy"/><img class="Thumbnail_thumb__UXO3a Thumbnail_contain__K6M0d" alt="BlueHat v18 || The matrix has you - protecting linux using deception" src="https://cdn.slidesharecdn.com/ss_thumbnails/0927-track2-pm-thematrixhasyou-protectinglinuxusingdeception-181011201719-thumbnail.jpg?width=560&amp;fit=bounds" loading="lazy"/></div><div class="SlideshowCard_content__xh7kV slideshow-card-content"><span class="slideshow-title SlideshowTitle_root__2VccW RailCard_title__Tvfiv ellipsis" style="-webkit-line-clamp:2" data-cy="slideshow-title">BlueHat v18 || The matrix has you - protecting linux using deception</span><button type="button" class="Button_root__i1yp0 Button_secondary__hHiHI Button_text__ZT_3O Button_small__sqsEx Button_icon__1C4qi save-slideshow-button SaveButton_root__b6zuu" data-testid="button" aria-checked="false" aria-label="Save BlueHat v18 || The matrix has you - protecting linux using deception for later" role="switch" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":Rbdsla7d6:" popovertarget=":Rbdsla7d6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-Rbdsla7d6"><span class="icon Icon_root__AjZyv" style="--size:24px"><span class="Icon_icon__4zzsG" style="mask-image:url(https://public.slidesharecdn.com/_next/static/media/save.ef1812e2.svg);background-color:currentColor"></span><span class="sr-only"></span></span></button><div class="Tooltip_root__7FS0Y" id=":Rbdsla7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="top" style="position-anchor:--popover-Rbdsla7d6"></div><a class="SlideshowAuthor_root__IkT1_ RailCard_author__JYeYZ slideshow-author ellipsis" data-testid="slideshow-author" data-cy="slideshow-author" href="https://www.slideshare.net/MSbluehat">BlueHat Security Conference</a><div class="slideshow-stats SlideshowStats_root__EQOR1 RailCard_stats__ZvZms"> </div><span aria-hidden="true" class="seo-only">Ross Bevington, Microsoft

In ‘The Matrix’ sentient machines subdue the population by developing a highly sophisticated simulation. High interaction honeypots are a lot like The Matrix, designed to convince an attacker to execute an attack so we can monitor them. But these honeypots are flawed!

Attackers are continually adapting in order to evade our defenses - meaning that it’s often not enough to just set up a honeypot and watch the results roll in. Is a new approach better?

Did you know that 40% of IaaS VMs in Azure are Linux? For Microsoft to protect itself and its customers Linux is a priority.

At MSTIC we’ve developed a new type of Linux honeypot that allows us to deceive and control the behavior of an attacker. We are using this to understand the person behind the attack, examining them as they examine us. Using these techniques, we are able to better track the person behind the threat, build better protections and ultimately protect more Linux users - whether they are using Azure or not.

In this presentation I’ll show some of the successes of running a Matrix like environment, failures where a glitch was spotted as well as deception approaches that could be applied to other domains. Finally I’ll show how easy it is to leverage Azure’s big data capabilities to build and ultimately query all this data at scale as well as how you can immediately reap the benefits of this work by connecting your Linux box to Azure Security Center.</span></div></div><div class="" id=":R1sla7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="bottom-start" style="position-anchor:--popover-R1sla7d6"></div><div class="separator Separator_root__70Ime Separator_horizontal__czVEa" style="--color:var(--blue-gray-200);--size:1px" role="separator"></div><div class="RailCard_root__rZUGY RailCard_hasDescription__MjSgf SlideshowCard_root__pD8t4 slideshow-card" aria-describedby="recommended-card-description-28" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":R1tla7d6:" popovertarget=":R1tla7d6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-R1tla7d6"><a class="SlideshowCardLink_root__p8KI7" data-cy="slideshow-card-link" data-testid="slideshow-card-link" href="https://www.slideshare.net/slideshow/ai-and-gender-decoding-the-sociological-impact/279357343"><span class="sr-only">AI and Gender: Decoding the Sociological Impact</span></a><div class="slideshow-thumbnail Thumbnail_root__qLW0K SlideshowCard_thumb__86aJk" style="aspect-ratio:1.5;--index:28" data-testid="card-thumbnail"><img class="Thumbnail_thumb__UXO3a Thumbnail_blur__opK6A Thumbnail_cover__1zsIi" alt="AI and Gender: Decoding the Sociological Impact" src="https://cdn.slidesharecdn.com/ss_thumbnails/ai-and-gender-decoding-the-sociological-impact-250519204829-a67c4dd7-thumbnail.jpg?width=560&amp;fit=bounds" loading="lazy"/><img class="Thumbnail_thumb__UXO3a Thumbnail_contain__K6M0d" alt="AI and Gender: Decoding the Sociological Impact" class="SlideshowCard_content__xh7kV slideshow-card-content"><span class="slideshow-title SlideshowTitle_root__2VccW RailCard_title__Tvfiv ellipsis" style="-webkit-line-clamp:2" data-cy="slideshow-title">AI and Gender: Decoding the Sociological Impact</span><button type="button" class="Button_root__i1yp0 Button_secondary__hHiHI Button_text__ZT_3O Button_small__sqsEx Button_icon__1C4qi save-slideshow-button SaveButton_root__b6zuu" data-testid="button" aria-checked="false" aria-label="Save AI and Gender: Decoding the Sociological Impact for later" role="switch" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":Rbdtla7d6:" popovertarget=":Rbdtla7d6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-Rbdtla7d6"><span class="icon Icon_root__AjZyv" style="--size:24px"><span class="Icon_icon__4zzsG" style="mask-image:url(https://public.slidesharecdn.com/_next/static/media/save.ef1812e2.svg);background-color:currentColor"></span><span class="sr-only"></span></span></button><div class="Tooltip_root__7FS0Y" id=":Rbdtla7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="top" style="position-anchor:--popover-Rbdtla7d6"></div><a class="SlideshowAuthor_root__IkT1_ RailCard_author__JYeYZ slideshow-author ellipsis" data-testid="slideshow-author" data-cy="slideshow-author" href="https://www.slideshare.net/SaikatBasu37">SaikatBasu37</a><div class="slideshow-stats SlideshowStats_root__EQOR1 RailCard_stats__ZvZms"> </div><span aria-hidden="true" class="seo-only">Exploring the Intersection of Technology and Society. How does AI shape our understanding of gender, and what does it mean for society?

</span></div></div><div class="" id=":R1tla7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="bottom-start" style="position-anchor:--popover-R1tla7d6"></div><div class="separator Separator_root__70Ime Separator_horizontal__czVEa" style="--color:var(--blue-gray-200);--size:1px" role="separator"></div><div class="RailCard_root__rZUGY RailCard_hasDescription__MjSgf SlideshowCard_root__pD8t4 slideshow-card" aria-describedby="recommended-card-description-29" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":R1ula7d6:" popovertarget=":R1ula7d6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-R1ula7d6"><a class="SlideshowCardLink_root__p8KI7" data-cy="slideshow-card-link" data-testid="slideshow-card-link" href="https://www.slideshare.net/slideshow/mulesoft-rtf-flex-gateway-on-aks-setup-insights-real-world-tips/279535917"><span class="sr-only">MuleSoft RTF &amp; Flex Gateway on AKS – Setup, Insights &amp; Real-World Tips</span></a><div class="slideshow-thumbnail Thumbnail_root__qLW0K SlideshowCard_thumb__86aJk" style="aspect-ratio:1.5;--index:29" data-testid="card-thumbnail"><img class="Thumbnail_thumb__UXO3a Thumbnail_blur__opK6A Thumbnail_cover__1zsIi" alt="MuleSoft RTF &amp; Flex Gateway on AKS – Setup, Insights &amp; Real-World Tips" src="https://cdn.slidesharecdn.com/ss_thumbnails/warsawmulesoftmeetup-april2025-250522192838-e4af02c4-thumbnail.jpg?width=560&amp;fit=bounds" loading="lazy"/><img class="Thumbnail_thumb__UXO3a Thumbnail_contain__K6M0d" alt="MuleSoft RTF &amp; Flex Gateway on AKS – Setup, Insights &amp; Real-World Tips" src="https://cdn.slidesharecdn.com/ss_thumbnails/warsawmulesoftmeetup-april2025-250522192838-e4af02c4-thumbnail.jpg?width=560&amp;fit=bounds" loading="lazy"/></div><div class="SlideshowCard_content__xh7kV slideshow-card-content"><span class="slideshow-title SlideshowTitle_root__2VccW RailCard_title__Tvfiv ellipsis" style="-webkit-line-clamp:2" data-cy="slideshow-title">MuleSoft RTF &amp; Flex Gateway on AKS – Setup, Insights &amp; Real-World Tips</span><button type="button" class="Button_root__i1yp0 Button_secondary__hHiHI Button_text__ZT_3O Button_small__sqsEx Button_icon__1C4qi save-slideshow-button SaveButton_root__b6zuu" data-testid="button" aria-checked="false" aria-label="Save MuleSoft RTF &amp; Flex Gateway on AKS – Setup, Insights &amp; Real-World Tips for later" role="switch" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":Rbdula7d6:" popovertarget=":Rbdula7d6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-Rbdula7d6"><span class="icon Icon_root__AjZyv" style="--size:24px"><span class="Icon_icon__4zzsG" style="mask-image:url(https://public.slidesharecdn.com/_next/static/media/save.ef1812e2.svg);background-color:currentColor"></span><span class="sr-only"></span></span></button><div class="Tooltip_root__7FS0Y" id=":Rbdula7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="top" style="position-anchor:--popover-Rbdula7d6"></div><a class="SlideshowAuthor_root__IkT1_ RailCard_author__JYeYZ slideshow-author ellipsis" data-testid="slideshow-author" data-cy="slideshow-author" href="https://www.slideshare.net/PatrykBandurski">Patryk Bandurski</a><div class="slideshow-stats SlideshowStats_root__EQOR1 RailCard_stats__ZvZms"> </div><span aria-hidden="true" class="seo-only">This presentation was delivered during the Warsaw MuleSoft Meetup in April 2025.
Paulina Uhman (PwC Polska) shared her hands-on experience running MuleSoft Runtime Fabric (RTF) and Flex Gateway on Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS).

The deck covers:

What happens after installation (pods, services, and artifacts demystified)

Shared responsibility model: MuleSoft vs Kubernetes

Real-world tips for configuring connectivity

Key Kubernetes commands for troubleshooting

Lessons learned from practical use cases

🎙️ Hosted by: Patryk Bandurski, MuleSoft Ambassador &amp; Meetup Leader
💡 Presented by: Paulina Uhman, Integration Specialist @ PwC Polska</span></div></div><div class="" id=":R1ula7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="bottom-start" style="position-anchor:--popover-R1ula7d6"></div></div><!--/$--></div></div><div class="BelowReaderAd_root__NKeGg" data-testid="below-reader-ad"></div><!--$--><div class="RelatedContent_root__29Np1"><div class="RelatedContent_wrapper__riU7l"><h2 class="Heading_heading__3MAvZ Heading_h2__f9yvs RelatedContent_title__QUhpL">More Related Content</h2><div class="bottom-recs BottomRecommendation_root__7aU9w"><h3 class="BottomRecommendation_title__SRj68">More from BlueHat Security Conference<!-- --> <span class="BottomRecommendation_count__4HpLo">(<!-- -->20<!-- -->)</span></h3><div class="BottomRecommendationContent_root__2qm4_"><div class="mobile-recs"><div class="RailCard_root__rZUGY RailCard_hasDescription__MjSgf SlideshowCard_root__pD8t4 slideshow-card" aria-describedby="moreFromUser-card-description-0" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":R8b5k7d6:" popovertarget=":R8b5k7d6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-R8b5k7d6"><a class="SlideshowCardLink_root__p8KI7" data-cy="slideshow-card-link" data-testid="slideshow-card-link" href="https://www.slideshare.net/slideshow/bluehat-seattle-2019-the-cake-is-a-lie-uncovering-the-secret-world-of-malwarelike-cheats-in-video-games/201112400"><span class="sr-only">BlueHat Seattle 2019 || The cake is a lie! Uncovering the secret world of mal...</span></a><div class="slideshow-thumbnail Thumbnail_root__qLW0K SlideshowCard_thumb__86aJk" style="aspect-ratio:1.5;--index:0" data-testid="card-thumbnail"><img class="Thumbnail_thumb__UXO3a Thumbnail_blur__opK6A Thumbnail_cover__1zsIi" alt="BlueHat Seattle 2019 || The cake is a lie! Uncovering the secret world of mal..." src="https://cdn.slidesharecdn.com/ss_thumbnails/santiagopontirolifinal-191203232734-thumbnail.jpg?width=560&amp;fit=bounds" loading="lazy"/><img class="Thumbnail_thumb__UXO3a Thumbnail_contain__K6M0d" alt="BlueHat Seattle 2019 || The cake is a lie! Uncovering the secret world of mal..." src="https://cdn.slidesharecdn.com/ss_thumbnails/santiagopontirolifinal-191203232734-thumbnail.jpg?width=560&amp;fit=bounds" loading="lazy"/></div><div class="SlideshowCard_content__xh7kV slideshow-card-content"><span class="slideshow-title SlideshowTitle_root__2VccW RailCard_title__Tvfiv ellipsis" style="-webkit-line-clamp:2" data-cy="slideshow-title">BlueHat Seattle 2019 || The cake is a lie! Uncovering the secret world of mal...</span><button type="button" class="Button_root__i1yp0 Button_secondary__hHiHI Button_text__ZT_3O Button_small__sqsEx Button_icon__1C4qi save-slideshow-button SaveButton_root__b6zuu" data-testid="button" aria-checked="false" aria-label="Save BlueHat Seattle 2019 || The cake is a lie! Uncovering the secret world of mal... for later" role="switch" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":R2r8b5k7d6:" popovertarget=":R2r8b5k7d6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-R2r8b5k7d6"><span class="icon Icon_root__AjZyv" style="--size:24px"><span class="Icon_icon__4zzsG" style="mask-image:url(https://public.slidesharecdn.com/_next/static/media/save.ef1812e2.svg);background-color:currentColor"></span><span class="sr-only"></span></span></button><div class="Tooltip_root__7FS0Y" id=":R2r8b5k7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="top" style="position-anchor:--popover-R2r8b5k7d6"></div><a class="SlideshowAuthor_root__IkT1_ RailCard_author__JYeYZ slideshow-author ellipsis" data-testid="slideshow-author" data-cy="slideshow-author" href="https://www.slideshare.net/MSbluehat">BlueHat Security Conference</a><div class="slideshow-stats SlideshowStats_root__EQOR1 RailCard_stats__ZvZms"> </div><span aria-hidden="true" class="seo-only">Santiago Pontiroli

With more than 2.5 billion gamers from all over the world, it&#x27;s no wonder that at least a fraction of them would bring into action additional tools to gain an unfair advantage over their opponents in the virtual world. This is one of the many reasons behind the existence and rapid growth of a multi-million dollar industry that thrives on selling cheats, hacks and modifications to desperate gamers seeking to gain the upper hand in their next match. Let&#x27;s dissect these tools and understand how modern games and anti-cheating technologies can be easily bypassed, all while we get a glimpse of the dubious market and supporting crews that develop, sell, and maintain the commodities in this illegal economy. It&#x27;s not unusual for cheats to be more expensive than the actual games they are trying to profit from, or for players to buy a single title over and over until they can avoid being banned by the protective measures implemented in the first place. Fortnite? Overwatch? League of Legends? If you&#x27;ve heard about these games but you don&#x27;t know what an aim-bot, a wall-hack, or an ESP means, then you might finally understand why all those competitive matches you played have made you feel like a fish out of water. Join me in this presentation and learn the inside-out of an industry that has remained in the shadows for a very long time. I will be presenting real world cheats used by gamers worldwide that in some cases closely mimic techniques that would rival numerous advanced threat actors in the malware ecosystem. Game over? Maybe not….</span></div></div><div class="" id=":R8b5k7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="bottom-start" style="position-anchor:--popover-R8b5k7d6"></div><div class="separator Separator_root__70Ime Separator_horizontal__czVEa" style="--color:var(--blue-gray-200);--size:1px" role="separator"></div><div class="RailCard_root__rZUGY RailCard_hasDescription__MjSgf SlideshowCard_root__pD8t4 slideshow-card" aria-describedby="moreFromUser-card-description-1" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":R8j5k7d6:" popovertarget=":R8j5k7d6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-R8j5k7d6"><a class="SlideshowCardLink_root__p8KI7" data-cy="slideshow-card-link" data-testid="slideshow-card-link" href="https://www.slideshare.net/slideshow/bluehat-seattle-2019-keynote/201077460"><span class="sr-only">BlueHat Seattle 2019 || Keynote</span></a><div class="slideshow-thumbnail Thumbnail_root__qLW0K SlideshowCard_thumb__86aJk" style="aspect-ratio:1.5;--index:1" data-testid="card-thumbnail"><img class="Thumbnail_thumb__UXO3a Thumbnail_blur__opK6A Thumbnail_cover__1zsIi" alt="BlueHat Seattle 2019 || Keynote" src="https://cdn.slidesharecdn.com/ss_thumbnails/alexstamos-191203214951-thumbnail.jpg?width=560&amp;fit=bounds" loading="lazy"/><img class="Thumbnail_thumb__UXO3a Thumbnail_contain__K6M0d" alt="BlueHat Seattle 2019 || Keynote" src="https://cdn.slidesharecdn.com/ss_thumbnails/alexstamos-191203214951-thumbnail.jpg?width=560&amp;fit=bounds" loading="lazy"/></div><div class="SlideshowCard_content__xh7kV slideshow-card-content"><span class="slideshow-title SlideshowTitle_root__2VccW RailCard_title__Tvfiv ellipsis" style="-webkit-line-clamp:2" data-cy="slideshow-title">BlueHat Seattle 2019 || Keynote</span><button type="button" class="Button_root__i1yp0 Button_secondary__hHiHI Button_text__ZT_3O Button_small__sqsEx Button_icon__1C4qi save-slideshow-button SaveButton_root__b6zuu" data-testid="button" aria-checked="false" aria-label="Save BlueHat Seattle 2019 || Keynote for later" role="switch" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":R2r8j5k7d6:" popovertarget=":R2r8j5k7d6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-R2r8j5k7d6"><span class="icon Icon_root__AjZyv" style="--size:24px"><span class="Icon_icon__4zzsG" style="mask-image:url(https://public.slidesharecdn.com/_next/static/media/save.ef1812e2.svg);background-color:currentColor"></span><span class="sr-only"></span></span></button><div class="Tooltip_root__7FS0Y" id=":R2r8j5k7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="top" style="position-anchor:--popover-R2r8j5k7d6"></div><a class="SlideshowAuthor_root__IkT1_ RailCard_author__JYeYZ slideshow-author ellipsis" data-testid="slideshow-author" data-cy="slideshow-author" href="https://www.slideshare.net/MSbluehat">BlueHat Security Conference</a><div class="slideshow-stats SlideshowStats_root__EQOR1 RailCard_stats__ZvZms"> </div><span aria-hidden="true" class="seo-only">This document discusses some fundamental problems in technology, including a lack of empathy and diversity in teams, an overvaluation of complexity, and misaligned incentives that prioritize growth and headlines over minimizing real-world harm. It argues that technology companies have not been proactively honest about downsides and have failed to learn from past mistakes. Some recommendations are made, including emphasizing empathy and diversity to better predict harm, shifting risk ownership, adjusting incentives away from complexity and towards harm prevention, and teaching these lessons in computer science education.</span></div></div><div class="" id=":R8j5k7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="bottom-start" style="position-anchor:--popover-R8j5k7d6"></div><div class="separator Separator_root__70Ime Separator_horizontal__czVEa" style="--color:var(--blue-gray-200);--size:1px" role="separator"></div><div class="RailCard_root__rZUGY RailCard_hasDescription__MjSgf SlideshowCard_root__pD8t4 slideshow-card" aria-describedby="moreFromUser-card-description-2" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":R8r5k7d6:" popovertarget=":R8r5k7d6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-R8r5k7d6"><a class="SlideshowCardLink_root__p8KI7" data-cy="slideshow-card-link" data-testid="slideshow-card-link" href="https://www.slideshare.net/slideshow/bluehat-seattle-2019-guarding-against-physical-attacks-the-xbox-one-story/201074777"><span class="sr-only">BlueHat Seattle 2019 || Guarding Against Physical Attacks: The Xbox One Story</span></a><div class="slideshow-thumbnail Thumbnail_root__qLW0K SlideshowCard_thumb__86aJk" style="aspect-ratio:1.5;--index:2" data-testid="card-thumbnail"><img class="Thumbnail_thumb__UXO3a Thumbnail_blur__opK6A Thumbnail_cover__1zsIi" alt="BlueHat Seattle 2019 || Guarding Against Physical Attacks: The Xbox One Story" src="https://cdn.slidesharecdn.com/ss_thumbnails/tonychenfinal-191203214356-thumbnail.jpg?width=560&amp;fit=bounds" loading="lazy"/><img class="Thumbnail_thumb__UXO3a Thumbnail_contain__K6M0d" alt="BlueHat Seattle 2019 || Guarding Against Physical Attacks: The Xbox One Story" src="https://cdn.slidesharecdn.com/ss_thumbnails/tonychenfinal-191203214356-thumbnail.jpg?width=560&amp;fit=bounds" loading="lazy"/></div><div class="SlideshowCard_content__xh7kV slideshow-card-content"><span class="slideshow-title SlideshowTitle_root__2VccW RailCard_title__Tvfiv ellipsis" style="-webkit-line-clamp:2" data-cy="slideshow-title">BlueHat Seattle 2019 || Guarding Against Physical Attacks: The Xbox One Story</span><button type="button" class="Button_root__i1yp0 Button_secondary__hHiHI Button_text__ZT_3O Button_small__sqsEx Button_icon__1C4qi save-slideshow-button SaveButton_root__b6zuu" data-testid="button" aria-checked="false" aria-label="Save BlueHat Seattle 2019 || Guarding Against Physical Attacks: The Xbox One Story for later" role="switch" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":R2r8r5k7d6:" popovertarget=":R2r8r5k7d6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-R2r8r5k7d6"><span class="icon Icon_root__AjZyv" style="--size:24px"><span class="Icon_icon__4zzsG" style="mask-image:url(https://public.slidesharecdn.com/_next/static/media/save.ef1812e2.svg);background-color:currentColor"></span><span class="sr-only"></span></span></button><div class="Tooltip_root__7FS0Y" id=":R2r8r5k7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="top" style="position-anchor:--popover-R2r8r5k7d6"></div><a class="SlideshowAuthor_root__IkT1_ RailCard_author__JYeYZ slideshow-author ellipsis" data-testid="slideshow-author" data-cy="slideshow-author" href="https://www.slideshare.net/MSbluehat">BlueHat Security Conference</a><div class="slideshow-stats SlideshowStats_root__EQOR1 RailCard_stats__ZvZms"> </div><span aria-hidden="true" class="seo-only">Tony Chen

Every game console since the first Atari was more or less designed to prevent the piracy of games and yet every single game console has been successfully modified to enable piracy. However, this trend has come to an end. Both the Xbox One and the PS4 have now been on the market for close to 6 years, without hackers being able to crack the system to enable piracy or cheating. This is the first time in history that game consoles have lasted this long without being cracked. In this talk, we will discuss how we achieved this for the Xbox One. We will first describe the Xbox security design goals and why it needs to guard against physical attacks, followed by descriptions of the hardware and software architecture to keep the Xbox secure. This includes details about the custom SoC we built with AMD and how we addressed the fact that all data read from flash, the hard drive, and even DRAM cannot be trusted. We will also discuss the corresponding software changes needed with the custom hardware to keep the system and the games secure against physical attacks.</span></div></div><div class="" id=":R8r5k7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="bottom-start" style="position-anchor:--popover-R8r5k7d6"></div><div class="separator Separator_root__70Ime Separator_horizontal__czVEa" style="--color:var(--blue-gray-200);--size:1px" role="separator"></div><div class="RailCard_root__rZUGY RailCard_hasDescription__MjSgf SlideshowCard_root__pD8t4 slideshow-card" aria-describedby="moreFromUser-card-description-3" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":R935k7d6:" popovertarget=":R935k7d6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-R935k7d6"><a class="SlideshowCardLink_root__p8KI7" data-cy="slideshow-card-link" data-testid="slideshow-card-link" href="https://www.slideshare.net/slideshow/bluehat-seattle-2019-kubernetes-practical-attack-and-defense/201073355"><span class="sr-only">BlueHat Seattle 2019 || Kubernetes Practical Attack and Defense</span></a><div class="slideshow-thumbnail Thumbnail_root__qLW0K SlideshowCard_thumb__86aJk" style="aspect-ratio:1.5;--index:3" data-testid="card-thumbnail"><img class="Thumbnail_thumb__UXO3a Thumbnail_blur__opK6A Thumbnail_cover__1zsIi" alt="BlueHat Seattle 2019 || Kubernetes Practical Attack and Defense" src="https://cdn.slidesharecdn.com/ss_thumbnails/jaybealefinal-191203214054-thumbnail.jpg?width=560&amp;fit=bounds" loading="lazy"/><img class="Thumbnail_thumb__UXO3a Thumbnail_contain__K6M0d" alt="BlueHat Seattle 2019 || Kubernetes Practical Attack and Defense" src="https://cdn.slidesharecdn.com/ss_thumbnails/jaybealefinal-191203214054-thumbnail.jpg?width=560&amp;fit=bounds" loading="lazy"/></div><div class="SlideshowCard_content__xh7kV slideshow-card-content"><span class="slideshow-title SlideshowTitle_root__2VccW RailCard_title__Tvfiv ellipsis" style="-webkit-line-clamp:2" data-cy="slideshow-title">BlueHat Seattle 2019 || Kubernetes Practical Attack and Defense</span><button type="button" class="Button_root__i1yp0 Button_secondary__hHiHI Button_text__ZT_3O Button_small__sqsEx Button_icon__1C4qi save-slideshow-button SaveButton_root__b6zuu" data-testid="button" aria-checked="false" aria-label="Save BlueHat Seattle 2019 || Kubernetes Practical Attack and Defense for later" role="switch" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":R2r935k7d6:" popovertarget=":R2r935k7d6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-R2r935k7d6"><span class="icon Icon_root__AjZyv" style="--size:24px"><span class="Icon_icon__4zzsG" style="mask-image:url(https://public.slidesharecdn.com/_next/static/media/save.ef1812e2.svg);background-color:currentColor"></span><span class="sr-only"></span></span></button><div class="Tooltip_root__7FS0Y" id=":R2r935k7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="top" style="position-anchor:--popover-R2r935k7d6"></div><a class="SlideshowAuthor_root__IkT1_ RailCard_author__JYeYZ slideshow-author ellipsis" data-testid="slideshow-author" data-cy="slideshow-author" href="https://www.slideshare.net/MSbluehat">BlueHat Security Conference</a><div class="slideshow-stats SlideshowStats_root__EQOR1 RailCard_stats__ZvZms"> </div><span aria-hidden="true" class="seo-only">Jay Beale

We will attack a real Kubernetes cluster called Bust-a-Kube, which was released in 2019 as a free learning tool. The demonstration will start by compromising a real application running in a Kubernetes pod&#x27;s container, gaining low privileged remote code execution inside that container. Next, we will explore what that compromised container can see on the cluster, finding the boundaries of its privileges. We will move laterally from that container to attack microservices on the cluster, gaining remote code execution in other containers, with higher privilege. We&#x27;ll find that one of those can interfere with a final highest-privilege container. That highest privilege container will permit us to abuse the Kubernetes API to compromise the entire cluster. This demonstration will involve graphic &quot;flags,&quot; allowing attendees to repeat the attack afterward as a downloadable solitaire &quot;capture the flag&quot; game. We&#x27;ll then discuss and perform a second demo to teach defenses, working backward to defeat necessary steps in the first demo&#x27;s chain of attacks. We&#x27;ll demonstrate using pod security policies to force an AppArmor profile onto any pod (container) being deployed. We&#x27;ll show how volume whitelists can block an attack, then demonstrate an evasion that defeats this defense. We&#x27;ll then weaken this attack with root capability limits and AppArmor. We&#x27;ll demonstrate an attack path where a bad actor can use a low-privilege Kubernetes cluster compromise to abuse the cloud provider APIs. This, in turn, leads to compromising the Kubernetes cluster more fully. We&#x27;ll discuss how to break this attack using a cloud metadata API security feature that&#x27;s Kubernetes-specific. In the course of these demonstrations, we&#x27;ll conduct the attacks both manually and with an open source attack tool called Peirates. Finally, we&#x27;ll discuss defenses that we did not use, including seccomp syscall whitelists, read-only root filesystems, and freely-available service meshes.</span></div></div><div class="" id=":R935k7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="bottom-start" style="position-anchor:--popover-R935k7d6"></div><div class="separator Separator_root__70Ime Separator_horizontal__czVEa" style="--color:var(--blue-gray-200);--size:1px" role="separator"></div><div class="RailCard_root__rZUGY RailCard_hasDescription__MjSgf SlideshowCard_root__pD8t4 slideshow-card" aria-describedby="moreFromUser-card-description-4" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":R9b5k7d6:" popovertarget=":R9b5k7d6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-R9b5k7d6"><a class="SlideshowCardLink_root__p8KI7" data-cy="slideshow-card-link" data-testid="slideshow-card-link" href="https://www.slideshare.net/slideshow/bluehat-seattle-2019-open-source-security-vulnerabilities-never-come-alone/201071791"><span class="sr-only">BlueHat Seattle 2019 || Open Source Security, vulnerabilities never come alone</span></a><div class="slideshow-thumbnail Thumbnail_root__qLW0K SlideshowCard_thumb__86aJk" style="aspect-ratio:1.5;--index:4" data-testid="card-thumbnail"><img class="Thumbnail_thumb__UXO3a Thumbnail_blur__opK6A Thumbnail_cover__1zsIi" alt="BlueHat Seattle 2019 || Open Source Security, vulnerabilities never come alone" src="https://cdn.slidesharecdn.com/ss_thumbnails/nicowaismanfinal-191203213741-thumbnail.jpg?width=560&amp;fit=bounds" loading="lazy"/><img class="Thumbnail_thumb__UXO3a Thumbnail_contain__K6M0d" alt="BlueHat Seattle 2019 || Open Source Security, vulnerabilities never come alone" src="https://cdn.slidesharecdn.com/ss_thumbnails/nicowaismanfinal-191203213741-thumbnail.jpg?width=560&amp;fit=bounds" loading="lazy"/></div><div class="SlideshowCard_content__xh7kV slideshow-card-content"><span class="slideshow-title SlideshowTitle_root__2VccW RailCard_title__Tvfiv ellipsis" style="-webkit-line-clamp:2" data-cy="slideshow-title">BlueHat Seattle 2019 || Open Source Security, vulnerabilities never come alone</span><button type="button" class="Button_root__i1yp0 Button_secondary__hHiHI Button_text__ZT_3O Button_small__sqsEx Button_icon__1C4qi save-slideshow-button SaveButton_root__b6zuu" data-testid="button" aria-checked="false" aria-label="Save BlueHat Seattle 2019 || Open Source Security, vulnerabilities never come alone for later" role="switch" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":R2r9b5k7d6:" popovertarget=":R2r9b5k7d6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-R2r9b5k7d6"><span class="icon Icon_root__AjZyv" style="--size:24px"><span class="Icon_icon__4zzsG" style="mask-image:url(https://public.slidesharecdn.com/_next/static/media/save.ef1812e2.svg);background-color:currentColor"></span><span class="sr-only"></span></span></button><div class="Tooltip_root__7FS0Y" id=":R2r9b5k7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="top" style="position-anchor:--popover-R2r9b5k7d6"></div><a class="SlideshowAuthor_root__IkT1_ RailCard_author__JYeYZ slideshow-author ellipsis" data-testid="slideshow-author" data-cy="slideshow-author" href="https://www.slideshare.net/MSbluehat">BlueHat Security Conference</a><div class="slideshow-stats SlideshowStats_root__EQOR1 RailCard_stats__ZvZms"> </div><span aria-hidden="true" class="seo-only">Nico Waisman

Open source has won and is here to stay, but it comes with challenges. Open Source security is one of them that we face as an industry. We all consume it but what about its code quality, security practices, … Over the last 3 months, Github&#x27;s Semmle Security Research Team has been triaging all open source CVEs and engaging on a subset of those performing variant analysis trying to uncover what it was missed. During this talk we will present some of these cases where we used QL to perform variant analysis, in addition to some others where we performed the full research (seed vulnerability and variant analysis) such as u-boot.</span></div></div><div class="" id=":R9b5k7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="bottom-start" style="position-anchor:--popover-R9b5k7d6"></div><div class="separator Separator_root__70Ime Separator_horizontal__czVEa" style="--color:var(--blue-gray-200);--size:1px" role="separator"></div><div class="RailCard_root__rZUGY RailCard_hasDescription__MjSgf SlideshowCard_root__pD8t4 slideshow-card" aria-describedby="moreFromUser-card-description-5" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":R9j5k7d6:" popovertarget=":R9j5k7d6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-R9j5k7d6"><a class="SlideshowCardLink_root__p8KI7" data-cy="slideshow-card-link" data-testid="slideshow-card-link" href="https://www.slideshare.net/MSbluehat/bluehat-seattle-2019-modern-binary-analysis-with-ils"><span class="sr-only">BlueHat Seattle 2019 || Modern Binary Analysis with ILs</span></a><div class="slideshow-thumbnail Thumbnail_root__qLW0K SlideshowCard_thumb__86aJk" style="aspect-ratio:1.5;--index:5" data-testid="card-thumbnail"><img class="Thumbnail_thumb__UXO3a Thumbnail_blur__opK6A Thumbnail_cover__1zsIi" alt="BlueHat Seattle 2019 || Modern Binary Analysis with ILs" src="https://cdn.slidesharecdn.com/ss_thumbnails/jordanandpeterfinal-191203213446-thumbnail.jpg?width=560&amp;fit=bounds" loading="lazy"/><img class="Thumbnail_thumb__UXO3a Thumbnail_contain__K6M0d" alt="BlueHat Seattle 2019 || Modern Binary Analysis with ILs" src="https://cdn.slidesharecdn.com/ss_thumbnails/jordanandpeterfinal-191203213446-thumbnail.jpg?width=560&amp;fit=bounds" loading="lazy"/></div><div class="SlideshowCard_content__xh7kV slideshow-card-content"><span class="slideshow-title SlideshowTitle_root__2VccW RailCard_title__Tvfiv ellipsis" style="-webkit-line-clamp:2" data-cy="slideshow-title">BlueHat Seattle 2019 || Modern Binary Analysis with ILs</span><button type="button" class="Button_root__i1yp0 Button_secondary__hHiHI Button_text__ZT_3O Button_small__sqsEx Button_icon__1C4qi save-slideshow-button SaveButton_root__b6zuu" data-testid="button" aria-checked="false" aria-label="Save BlueHat Seattle 2019 || Modern Binary Analysis with ILs for later" role="switch" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":R2r9j5k7d6:" popovertarget=":R2r9j5k7d6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-R2r9j5k7d6"><span class="icon Icon_root__AjZyv" style="--size:24px"><span class="Icon_icon__4zzsG" style="mask-image:url(https://public.slidesharecdn.com/_next/static/media/save.ef1812e2.svg);background-color:currentColor"></span><span class="sr-only"></span></span></button><div class="Tooltip_root__7FS0Y" id=":R2r9j5k7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="top" style="position-anchor:--popover-R2r9j5k7d6"></div><a class="SlideshowAuthor_root__IkT1_ RailCard_author__JYeYZ slideshow-author ellipsis" data-testid="slideshow-author" data-cy="slideshow-author" href="https://www.slideshare.net/MSbluehat">BlueHat Security Conference</a><div class="slideshow-stats SlideshowStats_root__EQOR1 RailCard_stats__ZvZms"> </div><span aria-hidden="true" class="seo-only">Jordan Wiens &amp; Peter LaFosse

Modern binary analysis, whether for discovering vulnerabilities or analyzing malware needs automation to deal with the volume of code under inspection. And yet, while Intermediate Languages (ILs) have been used for decades in compiler design and implementation, too few reverse engineers have any experience with them even though many reverse engineering tools (Binary Ninja, Ghidra, IDA) are built on top of ILs. Given that, it&#x27;s time to demystify this space and make it accessible beyond just computer scientists and researchers. There&#x27;s many potentially unfamiliar concepts related to ILs: single-static assignment, value-set analysis, three argument form versus tree-based designs, and others. But what matters is how these ILs can help you build better binary analysis tools. This talk not only gives you an overview of existing ILs used in reverse engineering, but more importantly, shows you how your tooling can benefit from them. From cross-platform analysis (follow a botnet from an x86-64 desktop to a mobile arm, to an embedded MIPS), to leveraging existing data-flow capabilities that brings some of the benefits both dynamic and static analysis together, this talk will demonstrate several examples of plugins that leverage ILs to improve your ability to automatically reason over compiled code.</span></div></div><div class="" id=":R9j5k7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="bottom-start" style="position-anchor:--popover-R9j5k7d6"></div><div class="separator Separator_root__70Ime Separator_horizontal__czVEa" style="--color:var(--blue-gray-200);--size:1px" role="separator"></div><div class="RailCard_root__rZUGY RailCard_hasDescription__MjSgf SlideshowCard_root__pD8t4 slideshow-card" aria-describedby="moreFromUser-card-description-6" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":R9r5k7d6:" popovertarget=":R9r5k7d6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-R9r5k7d6"><a class="SlideshowCardLink_root__p8KI7" data-cy="slideshow-card-link" data-testid="slideshow-card-link" href="https://www.slideshare.net/slideshow/bluehat-seattle-2019-dont-forget-to-subscribe/201068944"><span class="sr-only">BlueHat Seattle 2019 || Don&#x27;t forget to SUBSCRIBE.</span></a><div class="slideshow-thumbnail Thumbnail_root__qLW0K SlideshowCard_thumb__86aJk" style="aspect-ratio:1.5;--index:6" data-testid="card-thumbnail"><img class="Thumbnail_thumb__UXO3a Thumbnail_blur__opK6A Thumbnail_cover__1zsIi" alt="BlueHat Seattle 2019 || Don&#x27;t forget to SUBSCRIBE." class="Tooltip_root__7FS0Y" id=":R2r9r5k7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="top" style="position-anchor:--popover-R2r9r5k7d6"></div><a class="SlideshowAuthor_root__IkT1_ RailCard_author__JYeYZ slideshow-author ellipsis" data-testid="slideshow-author" data-cy="slideshow-author" href="https://www.slideshare.net/MSbluehat">BlueHat Security Conference</a><div class="slideshow-stats SlideshowStats_root__EQOR1 RailCard_stats__ZvZms"> </div><span aria-hidden="true" class="seo-only">Elvis Collado

This talk is about how an unauthenticated heap-based buffer overflow vulnerability was discovered and exploited within a router distributed by a market-leading ISP. Despite the targeted process utilizing mitigations such as DEP and ASLR, it still fell prey to known exploitation techniques. This talk will go over the thought process, failures, and road-blocks that were encountered and how they were overcame.</span></div></div><div class="" id=":R9r5k7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="bottom-start" style="position-anchor:--popover-R9r5k7d6"></div><div class="separator Separator_root__70Ime Separator_horizontal__czVEa" aria-describedby="moreFromUser-card-description-7" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":Ra35k7d6:" popovertarget=":Ra35k7d6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-Ra35k7d6"><a hacking Azure AD</span></a><div class="slideshow-thumbnail Thumbnail_root__qLW0K SlideshowCard_thumb__86aJk" style="aspect-ratio:1.5;--index:7" data-testid="card-thumbnail"><img loading="lazy"/></div><div class="SlideshowCard_content__xh7kV slideshow-card-content"><span class="slideshow-title SlideshowTitle_root__2VccW RailCard_title__Tvfiv ellipsis" style="-webkit-line-clamp:2" data-cy="slideshow-title">BlueHat Seattle 2019 || I&#x27;m in your cloud: A year of hacking Azure AD</span><button type="button" class="Button_root__i1yp0 Button_secondary__hHiHI Button_text__ZT_3O Button_small__sqsEx Button_icon__1C4qi save-slideshow-button SaveButton_root__b6zuu" data-testid="button" aria-checked="false" aria-label="Save BlueHat Seattle 2019 || I&#x27;m in your cloud: A year of hacking Azure AD for later" role="switch" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":R2ra35k7d6:" popovertarget=":R2ra35k7d6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-R2ra35k7d6"><span class="icon Icon_root__AjZyv" style="--size:24px"><span class="Icon_icon__4zzsG" style="mask-image:url(https://public.slidesharecdn.com/_next/static/media/save.ef1812e2.svg);background-color:currentColor"></span><span class="sr-only"></span></span></button><div class="Tooltip_root__7FS0Y" id=":R2ra35k7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="top" style="position-anchor:--popover-R2ra35k7d6"></div><a class="SlideshowAuthor_root__IkT1_ RailCard_author__JYeYZ slideshow-author ellipsis" data-testid="slideshow-author" data-cy="slideshow-author" href="https://www.slideshare.net/MSbluehat">BlueHat Security Conference</a><div class="slideshow-stats SlideshowStats_root__EQOR1 RailCard_stats__ZvZms"> </div><span aria-hidden="true" class="seo-only">Dirk-jan Mollema

How does one research the cloud? With solutions such as Azure AD and Office 365, the underlying platform architecture and designs are not publicly documented or accessible in the same way as on-premise. This makes analyzing the security of the platform harder for external researchers. In this talk I will explain the journey and discoveries of a year of trying to understand Azure AD, including the vulnerabilities discovered in the process. This ranges from gathering information about Azure AD via undocumented APIs to installing invisible backdoors and escalating privileges via limited roles or via the link with on-premise. While some of these vulnerabilities have been resolved, several of these are unintended consequences of Azure AD&#x27;s architecture and thus are important to consider when evaluating the security of your Azure AD environment. A basic understanding of Azure AD, Office 365 and its terminology is assumed for this talk.</span></div></div><div class="" id=":Ra35k7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="bottom-start" style="position-anchor:--popover-Ra35k7d6"></div><div class="separator Separator_root__70Ime Separator_horizontal__czVEa" style="--color:var(--blue-gray-200);--size:1px" role="separator"></div><div class="RailCard_root__rZUGY RailCard_hasDescription__MjSgf SlideshowCard_root__pD8t4 slideshow-card" aria-describedby="moreFromUser-card-description-8" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":Rab5k7d6:" popovertarget=":Rab5k7d6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-Rab5k7d6"><a class="SlideshowCardLink_root__p8KI7" data-cy="slideshow-card-link" data-testid="slideshow-card-link" href="https://www.slideshare.net/slideshow/bluehat-seattle-2019-autopsies-of-recent-dfir-investigations/201065970"><span class="sr-only">BlueHat Seattle 2019 || Autopsies of Recent DFIR Investigations</span></a><div class="slideshow-thumbnail Thumbnail_root__qLW0K SlideshowCard_thumb__86aJk" style="aspect-ratio:1.5;--index:8" data-testid="card-thumbnail"><img class="Thumbnail_thumb__UXO3a Thumbnail_blur__opK6A Thumbnail_cover__1zsIi" alt="BlueHat Seattle 2019 || Autopsies of Recent DFIR Investigations" src="https://cdn.slidesharecdn.com/ss_thumbnails/john-lukepeckfinal-191203212500-thumbnail.jpg?width=560&amp;fit=bounds" loading="lazy"/><img class="Thumbnail_thumb__UXO3a Thumbnail_contain__K6M0d" alt="BlueHat Seattle 2019 || Autopsies of Recent DFIR Investigations" src="https://cdn.slidesharecdn.com/ss_thumbnails/john-lukepeckfinal-191203212500-thumbnail.jpg?width=560&amp;fit=bounds" loading="lazy"/></div><div class="SlideshowCard_content__xh7kV slideshow-card-content"><span class="slideshow-title SlideshowTitle_root__2VccW RailCard_title__Tvfiv ellipsis" style="-webkit-line-clamp:2" data-cy="slideshow-title">BlueHat Seattle 2019 || Autopsies of Recent DFIR Investigations</span><button type="button" class="Button_root__i1yp0 Button_secondary__hHiHI Button_text__ZT_3O Button_small__sqsEx Button_icon__1C4qi save-slideshow-button SaveButton_root__b6zuu" data-testid="button" aria-checked="false" aria-label="Save BlueHat Seattle 2019 || Autopsies of Recent DFIR Investigations for later" role="switch" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":R2rab5k7d6:" popovertarget=":R2rab5k7d6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-R2rab5k7d6"><span class="icon Icon_root__AjZyv" style="--size:24px"><span class="Icon_icon__4zzsG" style="mask-image:url(https://public.slidesharecdn.com/_next/static/media/save.ef1812e2.svg);background-color:currentColor"></span><span class="sr-only"></span></span></button><div class="Tooltip_root__7FS0Y" id=":R2rab5k7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="top" style="position-anchor:--popover-R2rab5k7d6"></div><a class="SlideshowAuthor_root__IkT1_ RailCard_author__JYeYZ slideshow-author ellipsis" data-testid="slideshow-author" data-cy="slideshow-author" href="https://www.slideshare.net/MSbluehat">BlueHat Security Conference</a><div class="slideshow-stats SlideshowStats_root__EQOR1 RailCard_stats__ZvZms"> </div><span aria-hidden="true" class="seo-only">John-Luke Peck

This presentation will review in hindsight and retrospect several recent incident response engagements performed over the last 12 months by a 3rd-party (non-Microsoft affiliated) security and incident response services provider. During the talk the presenter will review what went well and what did not go well during the various engagements, with a particular focus on the data, services , and support available from Microsoft &amp; Office365/AzureAD, and how they were and were not able to be leveraged during the various engagements.

This will include a focus on areas where:
* Necessary data was not available because the client had not taken, or were unaware of the need to take, steps to enable collection of the data 
* The data &amp; services available were successfully used during response efforts 

The presentation will highlight: 
* Lessons learned about Office365/AzureAD and Incident Response 
* How Office365, AzureAD, and ATP services and data were used in the response efforts 
* Recommendations for Office365/AzureAD tenants to improve their security &amp; IR capabilities /before/ an incident occurs 
All presented examples and incidents will be de-identified to maintain and protect privacy and operational security. 

What this is NOT: 
* A service provider&#x27;s sales presentation </span></div></div><div class="" id=":Rab5k7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="bottom-start" style="position-anchor:--popover-Rab5k7d6"></div><div class="separator Separator_root__70Ime Separator_horizontal__czVEa" style="--color:var(--blue-gray-200);--size:1px" role="separator"></div><div class="RailCard_root__rZUGY RailCard_hasDescription__MjSgf SlideshowCard_root__pD8t4 slideshow-card" aria-describedby="moreFromUser-card-description-9" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":Raj5k7d6:" popovertarget=":Raj5k7d6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-Raj5k7d6"><a class="SlideshowCardLink_root__p8KI7" data-cy="slideshow-card-link" data-testid="slideshow-card-link" href="https://www.slideshare.net/slideshow/bluehat-seattle-2019-the-good-the-bad-the-ugly-of-ml-based-approaches-for-ransomware-detection/201064852"><span class="sr-only">BlueHat Seattle 2019 || The good, the bad &amp; the ugly of ML based approaches f...</span></a><div class="slideshow-thumbnail Thumbnail_root__qLW0K SlideshowCard_thumb__86aJk" style="aspect-ratio:1.5;--index:9" data-testid="card-thumbnail"><img class="Thumbnail_thumb__UXO3a Thumbnail_blur__opK6A Thumbnail_cover__1zsIi" alt="BlueHat Seattle 2019 || The good, the bad &amp; the ugly of ML based approaches f..." src="https://cdn.slidesharecdn.com/ss_thumbnails/lichenravisahita-191203212233-thumbnail.jpg?width=560&amp;fit=bounds" loading="lazy"/><img class="Thumbnail_thumb__UXO3a Thumbnail_contain__K6M0d" alt="BlueHat Seattle 2019 || The good, the bad &amp; the ugly of ML based approaches f..." src="https://cdn.slidesharecdn.com/ss_thumbnails/lichenravisahita-191203212233-thumbnail.jpg?width=560&amp;fit=bounds" loading="lazy"/></div><div class="SlideshowCard_content__xh7kV slideshow-card-content"><span class="slideshow-title SlideshowTitle_root__2VccW RailCard_title__Tvfiv ellipsis" style="-webkit-line-clamp:2" data-cy="slideshow-title">BlueHat Seattle 2019 || The good, the bad &amp; the ugly of ML based approaches f...</span><button type="button" class="Button_root__i1yp0 Button_secondary__hHiHI Button_text__ZT_3O Button_small__sqsEx Button_icon__1C4qi save-slideshow-button SaveButton_root__b6zuu" data-testid="button" aria-checked="false" aria-label="Save BlueHat Seattle 2019 || The good, the bad &amp; the ugly of ML based approaches f... for later" role="switch" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":R2raj5k7d6:" popovertarget=":R2raj5k7d6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-R2raj5k7d6"><span class="icon Icon_root__AjZyv" style="--size:24px"><span class="Icon_icon__4zzsG" style="mask-image:url(https://public.slidesharecdn.com/_next/static/media/save.ef1812e2.svg);background-color:currentColor"></span><span class="sr-only"></span></span></button><div class="Tooltip_root__7FS0Y" id=":R2raj5k7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="top" style="position-anchor:--popover-R2raj5k7d6"></div><a class="SlideshowAuthor_root__IkT1_ RailCard_author__JYeYZ slideshow-author ellipsis" data-testid="slideshow-author" data-cy="slideshow-author" href="https://www.slideshare.net/MSbluehat">BlueHat Security Conference</a><div class="slideshow-stats SlideshowStats_root__EQOR1 RailCard_stats__ZvZms"> </div><span aria-hidden="true" class="seo-only">Li Chen &amp; Ravi Sahita

In this talk, we juxtapose the resiliency and trustworthiness of composition of DL and classical ML algorithms for security, via a case study of evaluating the resiliency of ransomware detection via the generative adversarial network (GAN). We propose to use GAN to automatically produce dynamic features that exhibit generalized malicious behaviors that can reduce the efficacy of black-box ransomware classifiers. We examine the quality of the GAN-generated samples by comparing the statistical similarity of these samples to real ransomware and benign software. Further we investigate the latent subspace where the GAN-generated samples lie and explore reasons why such samples cause a certain class of ransomware classifiers to degrade in performance. The automatically generated adversarial samples can then be fed into the training set to reduce the blind spots of the detectors. 

There has been a surge of interest in using machine learning (ML) particularly deep learning (DL) to automatically detect malware through their dynamic behaviors. These approaches have achieved significant improvement in detection rates and lower false positive rates at large scale compared with traditional malware analysis methods. ML in threat detection has demonstrated to be a good cop to guard platform security. However it is imperative to evaluate - is ML-powered security resilient enough? 

To generate reliable traces of system activity, we can utilize CPU-based telemetry such as Intel Processor Trace which can be extracted via a hypervisor without guest instrumentation. We advocate that file I/O events extracted from Intel processor trace together with algorithmic improvements have shown potential stronger defense in ML -based model deployment in the wild to combat ransomware attack. Our results and discoveries should pose relevant questions for defenders such as how ML models can be made more resilient for robust enforcement of security objectives. </span></div></div><div class="" id=":Raj5k7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="bottom-start" style="position-anchor:--popover-Raj5k7d6"></div><div class="separator Separator_root__70Ime Separator_horizontal__czVEa" style="--color:var(--blue-gray-200);--size:1px" role="separator"></div><div class="RailCard_root__rZUGY RailCard_hasDescription__MjSgf SlideshowCard_root__pD8t4 slideshow-card" aria-describedby="moreFromUser-card-description-10" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":Rar5k7d6:" popovertarget=":Rar5k7d6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-Rar5k7d6"><a class="SlideshowCardLink_root__p8KI7" data-cy="slideshow-card-link" data-testid="slideshow-card-link" Why Does Application Security Take ...</span></a><div class="slideshow-thumbnail Thumbnail_root__qLW0K SlideshowCard_thumb__86aJk" style="aspect-ratio:1.5;--index:10" data-testid="card-thumbnail"><img
