slideshow-card-content"><span class="slideshow-title SlideshowTitle_root__2VccW RailCard_title__Tvfiv ellipsis" style="-webkit-line-clamp:2" data-cy="slideshow-title">BlueHat Seattle 2019 || Are We There Yet: Why Does Application Security Take ...</span><button type="button" class="Button_root__i1yp0 Button_secondary__hHiHI Button_text__ZT_3O Button_small__sqsEx Button_icon__1C4qi save-slideshow-button SaveButton_root__b6zuu" data-testid="button" aria-checked="false" aria-label="Save BlueHat Seattle 2019 || Are We There Yet: Why Does Application Security Take ... for later" role="switch" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":R2rar5k7d6:" popovertarget=":R2rar5k7d6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-R2rar5k7d6"><span class="icon Icon_root__AjZyv" style="--size:24px"><span class="Icon_icon__4zzsG" style="mask-image:url(https://public.slidesharecdn.com/_next/static/media/save.ef1812e2.svg);background-color:currentColor"></span><span class="sr-only"></span></span></button><div class="Tooltip_root__7FS0Y" id=":R2rar5k7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="top" style="position-anchor:--popover-R2rar5k7d6"></div><a class="SlideshowAuthor_root__IkT1_ RailCard_author__JYeYZ slideshow-author ellipsis" data-testid="slideshow-author" data-cy="slideshow-author" href="https://www.slideshare.net/MSbluehat">BlueHat Security Conference</a><div class="slideshow-stats SlideshowStats_root__EQOR1 RailCard_stats__ZvZms"> </div><span aria-hidden="true" class="seo-only">This document summarizes the findings of Veracode&#x27;s 10th annual State of Software Security report. The report is based on scan data from over 85,000 applications assessed between April 2018 and March 2019. Key findings include: (1) Most security flaws are eventually fixed but fix times have remained consistent, (2) The likelihood of flaws being fixed decreases over time leading to growing &quot;security debt&quot;, (3) Frequent scanning correlated with faster fix times and lower security debt indicating the benefits of DevSecOps practices. The data suggests security testing automation still lags DevOps adoption and developers prioritize recent flaws over severity.</span></div></div><div class="" id=":Rar5k7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="bottom-start" style="position-anchor:--popover-Rar5k7d6"></div><div class="separator Separator_root__70Ime Separator_horizontal__czVEa" style="--color:var(--blue-gray-200);--size:1px" role="separator"></div><div class="RailCard_root__rZUGY RailCard_hasDescription__MjSgf SlideshowCard_root__pD8t4 slideshow-card" aria-describedby="moreFromUser-card-description-11" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":Rb35k7d6:" popovertarget=":Rb35k7d6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-Rb35k7d6"><a class="SlideshowCardLink_root__p8KI7" data-cy="slideshow-card-link" data-testid="slideshow-card-link" href="https://www.slideshare.net/slideshow/bluehat-seattle-building-secure-machine-learning-pipelines-security-patterns-and-challenges/201020623"><span class="sr-only">BlueHat Seattle 2019 || Building Secure Machine Learning Pipelines: Security ...</span></a><div class="slideshow-thumbnail Thumbnail_root__qLW0K SlideshowCard_thumb__86aJk" style="aspect-ratio:1.5;--index:11" data-testid="card-thumbnail"><img class="Thumbnail_thumb__UXO3a Thumbnail_blur__opK6A Thumbnail_cover__1zsIi" alt="BlueHat Seattle 2019 || Building Secure Machine Learning Pipelines: Security ..." src="https://cdn.slidesharecdn.com/ss_thumbnails/anamitraduttamajumdaranubhavsainifinal-191203193454-thumbnail.jpg?width=560&amp;fit=bounds" loading="lazy"/><img class="Thumbnail_thumb__UXO3a Thumbnail_contain__K6M0d" alt="BlueHat Seattle 2019 || Building Secure Machine Learning Pipelines: Security ..." src="https://cdn.slidesharecdn.com/ss_thumbnails/anamitraduttamajumdaranubhavsainifinal-191203193454-thumbnail.jpg?width=560&amp;fit=bounds" loading="lazy"/></div><div class="SlideshowCard_content__xh7kV slideshow-card-content"><span class="slideshow-title SlideshowTitle_root__2VccW RailCard_title__Tvfiv ellipsis" style="-webkit-line-clamp:2" data-cy="slideshow-title">BlueHat Seattle 2019 || Building Secure Machine Learning Pipelines: Security ...</span><button type="button" class="Button_root__i1yp0 Button_secondary__hHiHI Button_text__ZT_3O Button_small__sqsEx Button_icon__1C4qi save-slideshow-button SaveButton_root__b6zuu" data-testid="button" aria-checked="false" aria-label="Save BlueHat Seattle 2019 || Building Secure Machine Learning Pipelines: Security ... for later" role="switch" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":R2rb35k7d6:" popovertarget=":R2rb35k7d6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-R2rb35k7d6"><span class="icon Icon_root__AjZyv" style="--size:24px"><span class="Icon_icon__4zzsG" style="mask-image:url(https://public.slidesharecdn.com/_next/static/media/save.ef1812e2.svg);background-color:currentColor"></span><span class="sr-only"></span></span></button><div class="Tooltip_root__7FS0Y" id=":R2rb35k7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="top" style="position-anchor:--popover-R2rb35k7d6"></div><a class="SlideshowAuthor_root__IkT1_ RailCard_author__JYeYZ slideshow-author ellipsis" data-testid="slideshow-author" data-cy="slideshow-author" href="https://www.slideshare.net/MSbluehat">BlueHat Security Conference</a><div class="slideshow-stats SlideshowStats_root__EQOR1 RailCard_stats__ZvZms"> </div><span aria-hidden="true" class="seo-only">Anamitra Dutta Majumdar &amp; Anubhav Saini

Increasing adoption of Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence by data-driven organizations like LinkedIn is posing some important challenges related to data security and privacy. On the one hand, member data is an asset that unlocks unlimited business potential whereas, on the other hand, the consumption of the data must happen in a secure and privacy-preserving manner. This poses an interesting challenge for security and operations teams in the organization. In this presentation, we will walk through all the well-known use cases of machine learning at LinkedIn and also the phases of a machine learning pipeline. We will identify key security gaps and the corresponding security controls to address the gaps at each phase of any machine learning pipeline. The associated scalability and operational challenges for the application of security control will be explained. Controls in each phase would be put into the perspective of the Productive Machine Learning pipeline phases being built at LinkedIn There will be a section on how Blueshift will impact the application of security controls once compute and data have been decoupled. By the end of the talk, we would have described what a secure machine learning pipeline looks like and what are the key security patterns to be put in place to secure the pipeline.</span></div></div><div class="" id=":Rb35k7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="bottom-start" style="position-anchor:--popover-Rb35k7d6"></div><div class="separator Separator_root__70Ime Separator_horizontal__czVEa" style="--color:var(--blue-gray-200);--size:1px" role="separator"></div><div class="RailCard_root__rZUGY RailCard_hasDescription__MjSgf SlideshowCard_root__pD8t4 slideshow-card" aria-describedby="moreFromUser-card-description-12" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":Rbb5k7d6:" popovertarget=":Rbb5k7d6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-Rbb5k7d6"><a class="SlideshowCardLink_root__p8KI7" data-cy="slideshow-card-link" data-testid="slideshow-card-link" href="https://www.slideshare.net/slideshow/bluehat-v18-first-strontium-uefi-rootkit-unveiled/120746716"><span class="sr-only">BlueHat v18 || First strontium uefi rootkit unveiled</span></a><div class="slideshow-thumbnail Thumbnail_root__qLW0K SlideshowCard_thumb__86aJk" style="aspect-ratio:1.5;--index:12" data-testid="card-thumbnail"><img class="Thumbnail_thumb__UXO3a Thumbnail_blur__opK6A Thumbnail_cover__1zsIi" alt="BlueHat v18 || First strontium uefi rootkit unveiled" src="https://cdn.slidesharecdn.com/ss_thumbnails/0927-track2-am-firststrontiumuefirootkitunveiled-181025231113-thumbnail.jpg?width=560&amp;fit=bounds" loading="lazy"/><img class="Thumbnail_thumb__UXO3a Thumbnail_contain__K6M0d" alt="BlueHat v18 || First strontium uefi rootkit unveiled" src="https://cdn.slidesharecdn.com/ss_thumbnails/0927-track2-am-firststrontiumuefirootkitunveiled-181025231113-thumbnail.jpg?width=560&amp;fit=bounds" loading="lazy"/></div><div class="SlideshowCard_content__xh7kV slideshow-card-content"><span class="slideshow-title SlideshowTitle_root__2VccW RailCard_title__Tvfiv ellipsis" style="-webkit-line-clamp:2" data-cy="slideshow-title">BlueHat v18 || First strontium uefi rootkit unveiled</span><button type="button" class="Button_root__i1yp0 Button_secondary__hHiHI Button_text__ZT_3O Button_small__sqsEx Button_icon__1C4qi save-slideshow-button SaveButton_root__b6zuu" data-testid="button" aria-checked="false" aria-label="Save BlueHat v18 || First strontium uefi rootkit unveiled for later" role="switch" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":R2rbb5k7d6:" popovertarget=":R2rbb5k7d6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-R2rbb5k7d6"><span class="icon Icon_root__AjZyv" style="--size:24px"><span class="Icon_icon__4zzsG" style="mask-image:url(https://public.slidesharecdn.com/_next/static/media/save.ef1812e2.svg);background-color:currentColor"></span><span class="sr-only"></span></span></button><div class="Tooltip_root__7FS0Y" id=":R2rbb5k7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="top" style="position-anchor:--popover-R2rbb5k7d6"></div><a class="SlideshowAuthor_root__IkT1_ RailCard_author__JYeYZ slideshow-author ellipsis" data-testid="slideshow-author" data-cy="slideshow-author" href="https://www.slideshare.net/MSbluehat">BlueHat Security Conference</a><div class="slideshow-stats SlideshowStats_root__EQOR1 RailCard_stats__ZvZms"> </div><span aria-hidden="true" class="seo-only">Jean-Ian Boutin, ESET 
Frédéric Vachon, ESET 

BIOS rootkits have been researched and discussed heavily in the past few years, but sparse evidence has been presented of real campaigns actively trying to compromise a system at this level. Our talk will reveal such a campaign successfully executed by STRONTIUM. 

Earlier this year, there was a public report stating that the infamous Sofacy/APT28/Sednit APT group successfully trojanized a userland LoJack agent and used it against their targets. LoJack, a controversial anti-theft software, was scrutinized by security researchers in the past because of its unusual persistence method: a module preinstalled in many computers&#x27; UEFI/BIOS software. Several security risks were found through the years in their product, but no large in-the-wild activity was ever detected until the discovery of the STRONTIUM group leveraging some of these vulnerabilities affecting the userland agent. However, through our research, we now know that they did not stop there: they also tried, and succeeded, in installing a custom UEFI module directly in the systems&#x27; SPI flash memory. 

In this talk, we will detail the full infection chain showing how STRONTIUM was able to install their custom UEFI module on key targets&#x27; computers. 
Additionally, we will provide an in-depth analysis of their UEFI module and the associated trojanized LoJack agent. </span></div></div><div class="" id=":Rbb5k7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="bottom-start" style="position-anchor:--popover-Rbb5k7d6"></div><div class="separator Separator_root__70Ime Separator_horizontal__czVEa" style="--color:var(--blue-gray-200);--size:1px" role="separator"></div><div class="RailCard_root__rZUGY RailCard_hasDescription__MjSgf SlideshowCard_root__pD8t4 slideshow-card" aria-describedby="moreFromUser-card-description-13" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":Rbj5k7d6:" popovertarget=":Rbj5k7d6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-Rbj5k7d6"><a class="SlideshowCardLink_root__p8KI7" data-cy="slideshow-card-link" data-testid="slideshow-card-link" href="https://www.slideshare.net/slideshow/bluehat-v18-wsl-reloaded-lets-try-to-do-better-fuzzing/120614117"><span class="sr-only">BlueHat v18 || WSL reloaded - Let&#x27;s try to do better fuzzing</span></a><div class="slideshow-thumbnail Thumbnail_root__qLW0K SlideshowCard_thumb__86aJk" style="aspect-ratio:1.5;--index:13" data-testid="card-thumbnail"><img class="Thumbnail_thumb__UXO3a Thumbnail_blur__opK6A Thumbnail_cover__1zsIi" alt="BlueHat v18 || WSL reloaded - Let&#x27;s try to do better fuzzing" src="https://cdn.slidesharecdn.com/ss_thumbnails/0927-track1-am-wslreloaded-letstrytodobetterfuzzing-181024215135-thumbnail.jpg?width=560&amp;fit=bounds" loading="lazy"/><img class="Thumbnail_thumb__UXO3a Thumbnail_contain__K6M0d" alt="BlueHat v18 || WSL reloaded - Let&#x27;s try to do better fuzzing" src="https://cdn.slidesharecdn.com/ss_thumbnails/0927-track1-am-wslreloaded-letstrytodobetterfuzzing-181024215135-thumbnail.jpg?width=560&amp;fit=bounds" loading="lazy"/></div><div class="SlideshowCard_content__xh7kV slideshow-card-content"><span class="slideshow-title SlideshowTitle_root__2VccW RailCard_title__Tvfiv ellipsis" style="-webkit-line-clamp:2" data-cy="slideshow-title">BlueHat v18 || WSL reloaded - Let&#x27;s try to do better fuzzing</span><button type="button" class="Button_root__i1yp0 Button_secondary__hHiHI Button_text__ZT_3O Button_small__sqsEx Button_icon__1C4qi save-slideshow-button SaveButton_root__b6zuu" data-testid="button" aria-checked="false" aria-label="Save BlueHat v18 || WSL reloaded - Let&#x27;s try to do better fuzzing for later" role="switch" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":R2rbj5k7d6:" popovertarget=":R2rbj5k7d6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-R2rbj5k7d6"><span class="icon Icon_root__AjZyv" style="--size:24px"><span class="Icon_icon__4zzsG" style="mask-image:url(https://public.slidesharecdn.com/_next/static/media/save.ef1812e2.svg);background-color:currentColor"></span><span class="sr-only"></span></span></button><div class="Tooltip_root__7FS0Y" id=":R2rbj5k7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="top" style="position-anchor:--popover-R2rbj5k7d6"></div><a class="SlideshowAuthor_root__IkT1_ RailCard_author__JYeYZ slideshow-author ellipsis" data-testid="slideshow-author" data-cy="slideshow-author" href="https://www.slideshare.net/MSbluehat">BlueHat Security Conference</a><div class="slideshow-stats SlideshowStats_root__EQOR1 RailCard_stats__ZvZms"> </div><span aria-hidden="true" class="seo-only">The document discusses the internals of syzkaller, an in-kernel fuzzer for finding bugs. It explains that syzkaller sprays large allocations across memory pages to leave small holes, then sprays the targeted object to fill one of the holes and have the target in front of the spray. This allows the target object to be found and used for exploitation. It also provides statistics on the types of bugs found by syzkaller, with most being exploitable bugs or crashes/stability issues found through fuzzing kernel interfaces.</span></div></div><div class="" id=":Rbj5k7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="bottom-start" style="position-anchor:--popover-Rbj5k7d6"></div><div class="separator Separator_root__70Ime Separator_horizontal__czVEa" style="--color:var(--blue-gray-200);--size:1px" role="separator"></div><div class="RailCard_root__rZUGY RailCard_hasDescription__MjSgf SlideshowCard_root__pD8t4 slideshow-card" aria-describedby="moreFromUser-card-description-14" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":Rbr5k7d6:" popovertarget=":Rbr5k7d6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-Rbr5k7d6"><a class="SlideshowCardLink_root__p8KI7" data-cy="slideshow-card-link" data-testid="slideshow-card-link" href="https://www.slideshare.net/slideshow/bluehat-v18-the-hitchhikers-guide-to-north-koreas-malware-galaxy/120613743"><span class="sr-only">BlueHat v18 || The hitchhiker&#x27;s guide to north korea&#x27;s malware galaxy</span></a><div class="slideshow-thumbnail Thumbnail_root__qLW0K SlideshowCard_thumb__86aJk" style="aspect-ratio:1.5;--index:14" data-testid="card-thumbnail"><img class="Thumbnail_thumb__UXO3a Thumbnail_blur__opK6A Thumbnail_cover__1zsIi" alt="BlueHat v18 || The hitchhiker&#x27;s guide to north korea&#x27;s malware galaxy" src="https://cdn.slidesharecdn.com/ss_thumbnails/0927-track3-am-thehitchhikersguidetonorthkoreasmalwaregalaxy-181024214609-thumbnail.jpg?width=560&amp;fit=bounds" loading="lazy"/><img class="Thumbnail_thumb__UXO3a Thumbnail_contain__K6M0d" alt="BlueHat v18 || The hitchhiker&#x27;s guide to north korea&#x27;s malware galaxy" src="https://cdn.slidesharecdn.com/ss_thumbnails/0927-track3-am-thehitchhikersguidetonorthkoreasmalwaregalaxy-181024214609-thumbnail.jpg?width=560&amp;fit=bounds" loading="lazy"/></div><div class="SlideshowCard_content__xh7kV slideshow-card-content"><span class="slideshow-title SlideshowTitle_root__2VccW RailCard_title__Tvfiv ellipsis" style="-webkit-line-clamp:2" data-cy="slideshow-title">BlueHat v18 || The hitchhiker&#x27;s guide to north korea&#x27;s malware galaxy</span><button type="button" class="Button_root__i1yp0 Button_secondary__hHiHI Button_text__ZT_3O Button_small__sqsEx Button_icon__1C4qi save-slideshow-button SaveButton_root__b6zuu" data-testid="button" aria-checked="false" aria-label="Save BlueHat v18 || The hitchhiker&#x27;s guide to north korea&#x27;s malware galaxy for later" role="switch" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":R2rbr5k7d6:" popovertarget=":R2rbr5k7d6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-R2rbr5k7d6"><span class="icon Icon_root__AjZyv" style="--size:24px"><span class="Icon_icon__4zzsG" style="mask-image:url(https://public.slidesharecdn.com/_next/static/media/save.ef1812e2.svg);background-color:currentColor"></span><span class="sr-only"></span></span></button><div class="Tooltip_root__7FS0Y" id=":R2rbr5k7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="top" style="position-anchor:--popover-R2rbr5k7d6"></div><a class="SlideshowAuthor_root__IkT1_ RailCard_author__JYeYZ slideshow-author ellipsis" data-testid="slideshow-author" data-cy="slideshow-author" href="https://www.slideshare.net/MSbluehat">BlueHat Security Conference</a><div class="slideshow-stats SlideshowStats_root__EQOR1 RailCard_stats__ZvZms"> </div><span aria-hidden="true" class="seo-only">Christiaan F Beek, McAfee
Jay Rosenberg, Intezer Labs

The Lazarus, Silent Chollima, Group 123, Hidden Cobra, DarkSeoul, Blockbuster, Operation Troy, 10 Days of Rain attacks are all believed to originate from North Korea. But how can they be attributed with certainty? And what connection does a DDoS and disk wiping attack from July 4 2009, have with WannaCry, one of the largest cyber-attacks in the history of the cyber-sphere? 

We have conducted a comparative research over more than 10 years of malware and tools being used by North Korean adversaries. The results were intriguing and we will share our discoveries but also hunt tactics during our talk. We discovered new links between campaigns and were able to group malware families towards actor groups and discovere interesting patterns.</span></div></div><div class="" id=":Rbr5k7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="bottom-start" style="position-anchor:--popover-Rbr5k7d6"></div><div class="separator Separator_root__70Ime Separator_horizontal__czVEa" style="--color:var(--blue-gray-200);--size:1px" role="separator"></div><div class="RailCard_root__rZUGY RailCard_hasDescription__MjSgf SlideshowCard_root__pD8t4 slideshow-card" aria-describedby="moreFromUser-card-description-15" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":Rc35k7d6:" popovertarget=":Rc35k7d6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-Rc35k7d6"><a class="SlideshowCardLink_root__p8KI7" data-cy="slideshow-card-link" data-testid="slideshow-card-link" href="https://www.slideshare.net/slideshow/bluehat-v18-retpoline-the-antispectre-type-2-mitigation-in-windows/119227043"><span class="sr-only">BlueHat v18 || Retpoline - the anti-spectre (type 2) mitigation in windows</span></a><div class="slideshow-thumbnail Thumbnail_root__qLW0K SlideshowCard_thumb__86aJk" style="aspect-ratio:1.5;--index:15" data-testid="card-thumbnail"><img class="Thumbnail_thumb__UXO3a Thumbnail_blur__opK6A Thumbnail_cover__1zsIi" alt="BlueHat v18 || Retpoline - the anti-spectre (type 2) mitigation in windows" src="https://cdn.slidesharecdn.com/ss_thumbnails/0927-track2-am-retpoline-theanti-spectretype2mitigationinwindows-181012163929-thumbnail.jpg?width=560&amp;fit=bounds" loading="lazy"/><img class="Thumbnail_thumb__UXO3a Thumbnail_contain__K6M0d" alt="BlueHat v18 || Retpoline - the anti-spectre (type 2) mitigation in windows" src="https://cdn.slidesharecdn.com/ss_thumbnails/0927-track2-am-retpoline-theanti-spectretype2mitigationinwindows-181012163929-thumbnail.jpg?width=560&amp;fit=bounds" loading="lazy"/></div><div class="SlideshowCard_content__xh7kV slideshow-card-content"><span class="slideshow-title SlideshowTitle_root__2VccW RailCard_title__Tvfiv ellipsis" style="-webkit-line-clamp:2" data-cy="slideshow-title">BlueHat v18 || Retpoline - the anti-spectre (type 2) mitigation in windows</span><button type="button" class="Button_root__i1yp0 Button_secondary__hHiHI Button_text__ZT_3O Button_small__sqsEx Button_icon__1C4qi save-slideshow-button SaveButton_root__b6zuu" data-testid="button" aria-checked="false" aria-label="Save BlueHat v18 || Retpoline - the anti-spectre (type 2) mitigation in windows for later" role="switch" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":R2rc35k7d6:" popovertarget=":R2rc35k7d6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-R2rc35k7d6"><span class="icon Icon_root__AjZyv" style="--size:24px"><span class="Icon_icon__4zzsG" style="mask-image:url(https://public.slidesharecdn.com/_next/static/media/save.ef1812e2.svg);background-color:currentColor"></span><span class="sr-only"></span></span></button><div class="Tooltip_root__7FS0Y" id=":R2rc35k7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="top" style="position-anchor:--popover-R2rc35k7d6"></div><a class="SlideshowAuthor_root__IkT1_ RailCard_author__JYeYZ slideshow-author ellipsis" data-testid="slideshow-author" data-cy="slideshow-author" href="https://www.slideshare.net/MSbluehat">BlueHat Security Conference</a><div class="slideshow-stats SlideshowStats_root__EQOR1 RailCard_stats__ZvZms"> </div><span aria-hidden="true" class="seo-only">Andrea Allievi, Microsoft

Spectre and Meltdown CPU have been one of the biggest security problem of the year 2018. Mitigations have already been delivered to the customers by both CPU manufacturers and OS developers. While the mitigations for Spectre type 1 and Meltdown have been successfully delivered, the mitigation for Spectre type 2, Retpoline, has been deferred for various problems. This talk will describe the implementation details of Retpoline in Windows 10 (19H1) and all the problem that we faced while testing it. Designing Retpoline has requested the collaboration of different teams in Microsoft, especially between the Kernel and the Compiler team. This talk will explain how we overcame all the implementation issues and allow all the involved Windows Kernel components to work with Retpoline in a retro-compatible way. At the end we will analyze the performance issues and explain how the Kernel team has found a solution for them</span></div></div><div class="" id=":Rc35k7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="bottom-start" style="position-anchor:--popover-Rc35k7d6"></div><div class="separator Separator_root__70Ime Separator_horizontal__czVEa" style="--color:var(--blue-gray-200);--size:1px" role="separator"></div><div class="RailCard_root__rZUGY RailCard_hasDescription__MjSgf SlideshowCard_root__pD8t4 slideshow-card" aria-describedby="moreFromUser-card-description-16" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":Rcb5k7d6:" popovertarget=":Rcb5k7d6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-Rcb5k7d6"><a class="SlideshowCardLink_root__p8KI7" data-cy="slideshow-card-link" data-testid="slideshow-card-link" href="https://www.slideshare.net/slideshow/bluehat-v18-memory-resident-implants-code-injection-is-alive-and-well/119226832"><span class="sr-only">BlueHat v18 || Memory resident implants - code injection is alive and well</span></a><div class="slideshow-thumbnail Thumbnail_root__qLW0K SlideshowCard_thumb__86aJk" style="aspect-ratio:1.5;--index:16" data-testid="card-thumbnail"><img class="Thumbnail_thumb__UXO3a Thumbnail_blur__opK6A Thumbnail_cover__1zsIi" alt="BlueHat v18 || Memory resident implants - code injection is alive and well" src="https://cdn.slidesharecdn.com/ss_thumbnails/0926-track2-pm-memoryresidentimplants-codeinjectionisaliveandwell-181012163626-thumbnail.jpg?width=560&amp;fit=bounds" loading="lazy"/><img class="Thumbnail_thumb__UXO3a Thumbnail_contain__K6M0d" alt="BlueHat v18 || Memory resident implants - code injection is alive and well" src="https://cdn.slidesharecdn.com/ss_thumbnails/0926-track2-pm-memoryresidentimplants-codeinjectionisaliveandwell-181012163626-thumbnail.jpg?width=560&amp;fit=bounds" loading="lazy"/></div><div class="SlideshowCard_content__xh7kV slideshow-card-content"><span class="slideshow-title SlideshowTitle_root__2VccW RailCard_title__Tvfiv ellipsis" style="-webkit-line-clamp:2" data-cy="slideshow-title">BlueHat v18 || Memory resident implants - code injection is alive and well</span><button type="button" class="Button_root__i1yp0 Button_secondary__hHiHI Button_text__ZT_3O Button_small__sqsEx Button_icon__1C4qi save-slideshow-button SaveButton_root__b6zuu" data-testid="button" aria-checked="false" aria-label="Save BlueHat v18 || Memory resident implants - code injection is alive and well for later" role="switch" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":R2rcb5k7d6:" popovertarget=":R2rcb5k7d6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-R2rcb5k7d6"><span class="icon Icon_root__AjZyv" style="--size:24px"><span class="Icon_icon__4zzsG" style="mask-image:url(https://public.slidesharecdn.com/_next/static/media/save.ef1812e2.svg);background-color:currentColor"></span><span class="sr-only"></span></span></button><div class="Tooltip_root__7FS0Y" id=":R2rcb5k7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="top" style="position-anchor:--popover-R2rcb5k7d6"></div><a class="SlideshowAuthor_root__IkT1_ RailCard_author__JYeYZ slideshow-author ellipsis" data-testid="slideshow-author" data-cy="slideshow-author" href="https://www.slideshare.net/MSbluehat">BlueHat Security Conference</a><div class="slideshow-stats SlideshowStats_root__EQOR1 RailCard_stats__ZvZms"> </div><span aria-hidden="true" class="seo-only">Luke Jennings, Countercept

Attackers have been avoiding disk and staying memory resident for over a decade and this has traditionally proven an Achilles heels for security products and the teams that operate them. The boom in both EDR products and memory forensics toolkits in more recent years have helped defenders to fight back but attackers are already adapting their approaches. 

This talk will cover both classic and modern techniques for injecting code into legitimate processes on Microsoft Windows systems, as well as several techniques for detecting them. This will include both system tracing methods, good for proactive detection, as well as memory analysis techniques that have the added benefit of allow detection of pre-existing compromises in real-world incident response scenarios, with a brief case study example. As part of this, practical examples will be given showing how Microsoft’s ATP and Sysmon help in this area as well as other techniques. Finally, the future of this area will be considered, including how the .NET runtime already complicates detection techniques in this area and how this will likely become increasingly challenging as more attackers discover and exploit this.

By the end of the talk, the audience should understand the importance of code injection in the context of memory-resident implants, the key techniques for performing it and detecting it and the challenges of achieving this in the real-world at enterprise scale.</span></div></div><div class="" id=":Rcb5k7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="bottom-start" style="position-anchor:--popover-Rcb5k7d6"></div><div class="separator Separator_root__70Ime Separator_horizontal__czVEa" style="--color:var(--blue-gray-200);--size:1px" role="separator"></div><div class="RailCard_root__rZUGY RailCard_hasDescription__MjSgf SlideshowCard_root__pD8t4 slideshow-card" aria-describedby="moreFromUser-card-description-17" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":Rcj5k7d6:" popovertarget=":Rcj5k7d6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-Rcj5k7d6"><a class="SlideshowCardLink_root__p8KI7" data-cy="slideshow-card-link" data-testid="slideshow-card-link" href="https://www.slideshare.net/slideshow/bluehat-v18-massive-scale-usb-device-driver-fuzz-without-device/119226365"><span class="sr-only">BlueHat v18 || Massive scale usb device driver fuzz without device</span></a><div class="slideshow-thumbnail Thumbnail_root__qLW0K SlideshowCard_thumb__86aJk" style="aspect-ratio:1.5;--index:17" data-testid="card-thumbnail"><img class="Thumbnail_thumb__UXO3a Thumbnail_blur__opK6A Thumbnail_cover__1zsIi" alt="BlueHat v18 || Massive scale usb device driver fuzz without device" src="https://cdn.slidesharecdn.com/ss_thumbnails/0927-track1-am-massivescaleusbdevicedriverfuzzwithoutdevice-181012162936-thumbnail.jpg?width=560&amp;fit=bounds" loading="lazy"/><img class="Thumbnail_thumb__UXO3a Thumbnail_contain__K6M0d" alt="BlueHat v18 || Massive scale usb device driver fuzz without device" src="https://cdn.slidesharecdn.com/ss_thumbnails/0927-track1-am-massivescaleusbdevicedriverfuzzwithoutdevice-181012162936-thumbnail.jpg?width=560&amp;fit=bounds" loading="lazy"/></div><div class="SlideshowCard_content__xh7kV slideshow-card-content"><span class="slideshow-title SlideshowTitle_root__2VccW RailCard_title__Tvfiv ellipsis" style="-webkit-line-clamp:2" data-cy="slideshow-title">BlueHat v18 || Massive scale usb device driver fuzz without device</span><button type="button" class="Button_root__i1yp0 Button_secondary__hHiHI Button_text__ZT_3O Button_small__sqsEx Button_icon__1C4qi save-slideshow-button SaveButton_root__b6zuu" data-testid="button" aria-checked="false" aria-label="Save BlueHat v18 || Massive scale usb device driver fuzz without device for later" role="switch" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":R2rcj5k7d6:" popovertarget=":R2rcj5k7d6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-R2rcj5k7d6"><span class="icon Icon_root__AjZyv" style="--size:24px"><span class="Icon_icon__4zzsG" style="mask-image:url(https://public.slidesharecdn.com/_next/static/media/save.ef1812e2.svg);background-color:currentColor"></span><span class="sr-only"></span></span></button><div class="Tooltip_root__7FS0Y" id=":R2rcj5k7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="top" style="position-anchor:--popover-R2rcj5k7d6"></div><a class="SlideshowAuthor_root__IkT1_ RailCard_author__JYeYZ slideshow-author ellipsis" data-testid="slideshow-author" data-cy="slideshow-author" href="https://www.slideshare.net/MSbluehat">BlueHat Security Conference</a><div class="slideshow-stats SlideshowStats_root__EQOR1 RailCard_stats__ZvZms"> </div><span aria-hidden="true" class="seo-only">Zhuo Ma, Tencent

USB is one of the most common interface supported on modern computer. Modern OSes offer tons of USB drivers to support frequently used USB device classes. For other 3rd party USB device, Microsoft provide automatic driver downloading and installation via Windows AutoUpdate Service. In this talk, we consider this as a novel attacking surface exposed by Windows.

We are trying to assess the vulnerability in those USB drivers provided via Windows AutoUpdate Service, which can be automatic installed and run after device plugged in. Obviously, these drivers are all designed for real USB device, which have to talk to device during running. 

So, the biggest obstacle for assessing these drivers is we can not prepare real USB devices for all of these drivers. To overcome this, We developed a system to emulate these USB device, further, we are trying to fuzz these drivers against our emulated USB device. By using this system, we can fuzz device drivers without the real USB device. In further, we can also precisely fuzz every stage of driver loading. We can feed any custom data to the drivers to trigger vulnerabilities. Also, this system supports IO Control Code fuzz as well. And all in all, all of this progress can be done automatically. 

We tested about 6000 drivers, yielded hundreds of crash by fuzzing. IO Control Fuzz also gave a reasonable result. We are going to divide our talk into three parts: the first part is about how we get the list of automatic installed USB drivers, and how to analyze these drivers in automatic ways; the second part is about the fuzzing system we designed, including the architecture of system, ways to emulating devices, key points for designing; the last part will show some vulnerabilities we found by this system.</span></div></div><div class="" id=":Rcj5k7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="bottom-start" style="position-anchor:--popover-Rcj5k7d6"></div><div class="separator Separator_root__70Ime Separator_horizontal__czVEa" style="--color:var(--blue-gray-200);--size:1px" role="separator"></div><div class="RailCard_root__rZUGY RailCard_hasDescription__MjSgf SlideshowCard_root__pD8t4 slideshow-card" aria-describedby="moreFromUser-card-description-18" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":Rcr5k7d6:" popovertarget=":Rcr5k7d6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-Rcr5k7d6"><a class="SlideshowCardLink_root__p8KI7" data-cy="slideshow-card-link" data-testid="slideshow-card-link" href="https://www.slideshare.net/slideshow/bluehat-v18-modern-day-entomology-examining-the-inner-workings-of-the-bug-bazaar/119145473"><span class="sr-only">BlueHat v18 || Modern day entomology - examining the inner workings of the bu...</span></a><div class="slideshow-thumbnail Thumbnail_root__qLW0K SlideshowCard_thumb__86aJk" style="aspect-ratio:1.5;--index:18" data-testid="card-thumbnail"><img class="Thumbnail_thumb__UXO3a Thumbnail_blur__opK6A Thumbnail_cover__1zsIi" alt="BlueHat v18 || Modern day entomology - examining the inner workings of the bu..." src="https://cdn.slidesharecdn.com/ss_thumbnails/0926-track3-pm-moderndayentomology-examiningtheinnerworkingsofthebugbazaar-181011202716-thumbnail.jpg?width=560&amp;fit=bounds" loading="lazy"/><img class="Thumbnail_thumb__UXO3a Thumbnail_contain__K6M0d" alt="BlueHat v18 || Modern day entomology - examining the inner workings of the bu..." src="https://cdn.slidesharecdn.com/ss_thumbnails/0926-track3-pm-moderndayentomology-examiningtheinnerworkingsofthebugbazaar-181011202716-thumbnail.jpg?width=560&amp;fit=bounds" loading="lazy"/></div><div class="SlideshowCard_content__xh7kV slideshow-card-content"><span class="slideshow-title SlideshowTitle_root__2VccW RailCard_title__Tvfiv ellipsis" style="-webkit-line-clamp:2" data-cy="slideshow-title">BlueHat v18 || Modern day entomology - examining the inner workings of the bu...</span><button type="button" class="Button_root__i1yp0 Button_secondary__hHiHI Button_text__ZT_3O Button_small__sqsEx Button_icon__1C4qi save-slideshow-button SaveButton_root__b6zuu" data-testid="button" aria-checked="false" aria-label="Save BlueHat v18 || Modern day entomology - examining the inner workings of the bu... for later" role="switch" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":R2rcr5k7d6:" popovertarget=":R2rcr5k7d6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-R2rcr5k7d6"><span class="icon Icon_root__AjZyv" style="--size:24px"><span class="Icon_icon__4zzsG" style="mask-image:url(https://public.slidesharecdn.com/_next/static/media/save.ef1812e2.svg);background-color:currentColor"></span><span class="sr-only"></span></span></button><div class="Tooltip_root__7FS0Y" id=":R2rcr5k7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="top" style="position-anchor:--popover-R2rcr5k7d6"></div><a class="SlideshowAuthor_root__IkT1_ RailCard_author__JYeYZ slideshow-author ellipsis" data-testid="slideshow-author" data-cy="slideshow-author" href="https://www.slideshare.net/MSbluehat">BlueHat Security Conference</a><div class="slideshow-stats SlideshowStats_root__EQOR1 RailCard_stats__ZvZms"> </div><span aria-hidden="true" class="seo-only">The document discusses the modern zero-day exploit market and economy. It describes how vulnerabilities are found by researchers and sold through brokers to various parties, including governments, criminals, and exploit kit creators. It also outlines trends in the market, such as the impact of new mitigations, regulations, and events like Pwn2Own on the sale of exploits. Finally, it shares some examples of vulnerabilities the Zero Day Initiative has helped patch and the conclusion encourages questions.</span></div></div><div class="" id=":Rcr5k7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="bottom-start" style="position-anchor:--popover-Rcr5k7d6"></div><div class="separator Separator_root__70Ime Separator_horizontal__czVEa" style="--color:var(--blue-gray-200);--size:1px" role="separator"></div><div class="RailCard_root__rZUGY RailCard_hasDescription__MjSgf SlideshowCard_root__pD8t4 slideshow-card" aria-describedby="moreFromUser-card-description-19" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":Rd35k7d6:" popovertarget=":Rd35k7d6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-Rd35k7d6"><a class="SlideshowCardLink_root__p8KI7" data-cy="slideshow-card-link" data-testid="slideshow-card-link" href="https://www.slideshare.net/slideshow/bluehat-v18-the-matrix-has-you-protecting-linux-using-deception/119144744"><span class="sr-only">BlueHat v18 || The matrix has you - protecting linux using deception</span></a><div class="slideshow-thumbnail Thumbnail_root__qLW0K SlideshowCard_thumb__86aJk" style="aspect-ratio:1.5;--index:19" data-testid="card-thumbnail"><img class="Thumbnail_thumb__UXO3a Thumbnail_blur__opK6A Thumbnail_cover__1zsIi" alt="BlueHat v18 || The matrix has you - protecting linux using deception" src="https://cdn.slidesharecdn.com/ss_thumbnails/0927-track2-pm-thematrixhasyou-protectinglinuxusingdeception-181011201719-thumbnail.jpg?width=560&amp;fit=bounds" loading="lazy"/><img class="Thumbnail_thumb__UXO3a Thumbnail_contain__K6M0d" alt="BlueHat v18 || The matrix has you - protecting linux using deception" src="https://cdn.slidesharecdn.com/ss_thumbnails/0927-track2-pm-thematrixhasyou-protectinglinuxusingdeception-181011201719-thumbnail.jpg?width=560&amp;fit=bounds" loading="lazy"/></div><div class="SlideshowCard_content__xh7kV slideshow-card-content"><span class="slideshow-title SlideshowTitle_root__2VccW RailCard_title__Tvfiv ellipsis" style="-webkit-line-clamp:2" data-cy="slideshow-title">BlueHat v18 || The matrix has you - protecting linux using deception</span><button type="button" class="Button_root__i1yp0 Button_secondary__hHiHI Button_text__ZT_3O Button_small__sqsEx Button_icon__1C4qi save-slideshow-button SaveButton_root__b6zuu" data-testid="button" aria-checked="false" aria-label="Save BlueHat v18 || The matrix has you - protecting linux using deception for later" role="switch" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":R2rd35k7d6:" popovertarget=":R2rd35k7d6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-R2rd35k7d6"><span class="icon Icon_root__AjZyv" style="--size:24px"><span class="Icon_icon__4zzsG" style="mask-image:url(https://public.slidesharecdn.com/_next/static/media/save.ef1812e2.svg);background-color:currentColor"></span><span class="sr-only"></span></span></button><div class="Tooltip_root__7FS0Y" id=":R2rd35k7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="top" style="position-anchor:--popover-R2rd35k7d6"></div><a class="SlideshowAuthor_root__IkT1_ RailCard_author__JYeYZ slideshow-author ellipsis" data-testid="slideshow-author" data-cy="slideshow-author" href="https://www.slideshare.net/MSbluehat">BlueHat Security Conference</a><div class="slideshow-stats SlideshowStats_root__EQOR1 RailCard_stats__ZvZms"> </div><span aria-hidden="true" class="seo-only">Ross Bevington, Microsoft

In ‘The Matrix’ sentient machines subdue the population by developing a highly sophisticated simulation. High interaction honeypots are a lot like The Matrix, designed to convince an attacker to execute an attack so we can monitor them. But these honeypots are flawed!

Attackers are continually adapting in order to evade our defenses - meaning that it’s often not enough to just set up a honeypot and watch the results roll in. Is a new approach better?

Did you know that 40% of IaaS VMs in Azure are Linux? For Microsoft to protect itself and its customers Linux is a priority.

At MSTIC we’ve developed a new type of Linux honeypot that allows us to deceive and control the behavior of an attacker. We are using this to understand the person behind the attack, examining them as they examine us. Using these techniques, we are able to better track the person behind the threat, build better protections and ultimately protect more Linux users - whether they are using Azure or not.

In this presentation I’ll show some of the successes of running a Matrix like environment, failures where a glitch was spotted as well as deception approaches that could be applied to other domains. Finally I’ll show how easy it is to leverage Azure’s big data capabilities to build and ultimately query all this data at scale as well as how you can immediately reap the benefits of this work by connecting your Linux box to Azure Security Center.</span></div></div><div class="" id=":Rd35k7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="bottom-start" style="position-anchor:--popover-Rd35k7d6"></div></div><div class="desktop-recs"><div class="Slider_root__c0Jo8"><div class="Slider_scroller__KHjw4"><div class="BottomRecommendationCard_root__gffTk SlideshowCard_root__pD8t4 slideshow-card"><a class="SlideshowCardLink_root__p8KI7" data-cy="slideshow-card-link" data-testid="slideshow-card-link" href="https://www.slideshare.net/slideshow/bluehat-seattle-2019-the-cake-is-a-lie-uncovering-the-secret-world-of-malwarelike-cheats-in-video-games/201112400"><span class="sr-only">BlueHat Seattle 2019 || The cake is a lie! Uncovering the secret world of mal...</span></a><div class="slideshow-thumbnail Thumbnail_root__qLW0K SlideshowCard_thumb__86aJk" style="aspect-ratio:16 / 9;--index:0" data-testid="card-thumbnail"><img class="Thumbnail_thumb__UXO3a Thumbnail_blur__opK6A Thumbnail_cover__1zsIi" alt="BlueHat Seattle 2019 || The cake is a lie! Uncovering the secret world of mal..." src="https://cdn.slidesharecdn.com/ss_thumbnails/santiagopontirolifinal-191203232734-thumbnail.jpg?width=560&amp;fit=bounds" loading="lazy"/></div><div class="SlideshowCard_content__xh7kV slideshow-card-content"><span class="slideshow-title SlideshowTitle_root__2VccW ellipsis" style="-webkit-line-clamp:2" data-cy="slideshow-title">BlueHat Seattle 2019 || The cake is a lie! Uncovering the secret world of mal...</span><button type="button" class="Button_root__i1yp0 Button_secondary__hHiHI Button_text__ZT_3O Button_small__sqsEx Button_icon__1C4qi save-slideshow-button SaveButton_root__b6zuu" data-testid="button" aria-checked="false" aria-label="Save BlueHat Seattle 2019 || The cake is a lie! ellipsis" data-testid="slideshow-author" data-cy="slideshow-author" href="https://www.slideshare.net/MSbluehat">BlueHat Security Conference</a><div class="slideshow-stats data-cy="slideshow-card-link" data-testid="slideshow-card-link" href="https://www.slideshare.net/slideshow/bluehat-seattle-2019-keynote/201077460"><span class="sr-only">BlueHat Seattle 2019 || Keynote</span></a><div class="slideshow-thumbnail Thumbnail_root__qLW0K SlideshowCard_thumb__86aJk" style="aspect-ratio:16 / 9;--index:1" data-testid="card-thumbnail"><img alt="BlueHat Seattle 2019 || Keynote" src="https://cdn.slidesharecdn.com/ss_thumbnails/alexstamos-191203214951-thumbnail.jpg?width=560&amp;fit=bounds" loading="lazy"/></div><div 2019 || Keynote</span><button type="button" class="Button_root__i1yp0 Button_secondary__hHiHI Button_text__ZT_3O Button_small__sqsEx Button_icon__1C4qi save-slideshow-button SaveButton_root__b6zuu" class="Tooltip_root__7FS0Y" id=":Rb2d5k7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="top" style="position-anchor:--popover-Rb2d5k7d6"></div><a class="SlideshowAuthor_root__IkT1_ slideshow-author ellipsis" data-testid="slideshow-author" data-cy="slideshow-author" href="https://www.slideshare.net/MSbluehat">BlueHat Security Conference</a><div class="slideshow-stats SlideshowStats_root__EQOR1"> </div></div></div><div class="BottomRecommendationCard_root__gffTk SlideshowCard_root__pD8t4 slideshow-card"><a class="SlideshowCardLink_root__p8KI7" data-cy="slideshow-card-link" data-testid="slideshow-card-link" href="https://www.slideshare.net/slideshow/bluehat-seattle-2019-guarding-against-physical-attacks-the-xbox-one-story/201074777"><span class="sr-only">BlueHat Seattle 2019 || Guarding Against Physical Attacks: The Xbox One Story</span></a><div class="slideshow-thumbnail Thumbnail_root__qLW0K SlideshowCard_thumb__86aJk" Paulina Uhman (PwC Polska) shared her hands-on experience running MuleSoft Runtime Fabric (RTF) and Flex Gateway on Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS).

The deck covers:

What happens after installation (pods, services, and artifacts demystified)

Shared responsibility model: MuleSoft vs Kubernetes

Real-world tips for configuring connectivity

Key Kubernetes commands for troubleshooting

Lessons learned from practical use cases

🎙️ Hosted by: Patryk Bandurski, MuleSoft Ambassador &amp; Meetup Leader
💡 Presented by: Paulina Uhman, Integration Specialist @ PwC Polska</span></div></div><div class="" id=":R8j6k7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="bottom-start" class="SlideshowAuthor_root__IkT1_ RailCard_author__JYeYZ slideshow-author ellipsis" data-testid="slideshow-author" data-cy="slideshow-author" href="https://www.slideshare.net/ShapeBlue">ShapeBlue</a><div class="slideshow-stats SlideshowStats_root__EQOR1 RailCard_stats__ZvZms"> </div><span aria-hidden="true" class="seo-only">In Apache CloudStack, zones are typically perceived as single datacenters. But what if you need to extend your CloudStack deployment across multiple datacenters? How can you seamlessly distribute and migrate virtual machines across them? In this session, Wido den Hollander explored strategies, best practices, and real-world considerations for achieving a multi-datacenter CloudStack setup.

--

The CloudStack European User Group 2025 took place on May 8th in Vienna, Austria. The event once again brought together open-source cloud professionals, contributors, developers, and users for a day of deep technical insights, knowledge sharing, and community connection.
</span></div></div><div class="" id=":R8r6k7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="bottom-start" style="position-anchor:--popover-R8r6k7d6"></div><div class="separator Separator_root__70Ime Separator_horizontal__czVEa" style="--color:var(--blue-gray-200);--size:1px" role="separator"></div><div class="RailCard_root__rZUGY RailCard_hasDescription__MjSgf SlideshowCard_root__pD8t4 slideshow-card" aria-describedby="latest-card-description-3" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":R936k7d6:" popovertarget=":R936k7d6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-R936k7d6"><a class="SlideshowCardLink_root__p8KI7" data-cy="slideshow-card-link" data-testid="slideshow-card-link" href="https://www.slideshare.net/slideshow/trustarc-webinar-cross-border-data-transfers-in-2025/279419076"><span class="sr-only">TrustArc Webinar: Cross-Border Data Transfers in 2025</span></a><div class="slideshow-thumbnail Thumbnail_root__qLW0K SlideshowCard_thumb__86aJk" style="aspect-ratio:1.5;--index:3" data-testid="card-thumbnail"><img class="Thumbnail_thumb__UXO3a Thumbnail_blur__opK6A Thumbnail_cover__1zsIi" alt="TrustArc Webinar: Cross-Border Data Transfers in 2025" src="https://cdn.slidesharecdn.com/ss_thumbnails/trustarcwebinar-cross-borderdatatransfersin2025-250520185720-677fb9b5-thumbnail.jpg?width=560&amp;fit=bounds" loading="lazy"/><img class="Thumbnail_thumb__UXO3a Thumbnail_contain__K6M0d" alt="TrustArc Webinar: Cross-Border Data Transfers in 2025" src="https://cdn.slidesharecdn.com/ss_thumbnails/trustarcwebinar-cross-borderdatatransfersin2025-250520185720-677fb9b5-thumbnail.jpg?width=560&amp;fit=bounds" loading="lazy"/></div><div class="SlideshowCard_content__xh7kV slideshow-card-content"><span class="slideshow-title SlideshowTitle_root__2VccW RailCard_title__Tvfiv ellipsis" style="-webkit-line-clamp:2" data-cy="slideshow-title">TrustArc Webinar: Cross-Border Data Transfers in 2025</span><button type="button" class="Button_root__i1yp0 Button_secondary__hHiHI Button_text__ZT_3O Button_small__sqsEx Button_icon__1C4qi save-slideshow-button SaveButton_root__b6zuu" data-testid="button" aria-checked="false" aria-label="Save TrustArc Webinar: Cross-Border Data Transfers in 2025 for later" role="switch" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":R2r936k7d6:" popovertarget=":R2r936k7d6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-R2r936k7d6"><span class="icon Icon_root__AjZyv" style="--size:24px"><span class="Icon_icon__4zzsG" style="mask-image:url(https://public.slidesharecdn.com/_next/static/media/save.ef1812e2.svg);background-color:currentColor"></span><span class="sr-only"></span></span></button><div class="Tooltip_root__7FS0Y" id=":R2r936k7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="top" style="position-anchor:--popover-R2r936k7d6"></div><a class="SlideshowAuthor_root__IkT1_ RailCard_author__JYeYZ slideshow-author ellipsis" data-testid="slideshow-author" data-cy="slideshow-author" href="https://www.slideshare.net/TrustArc">TrustArc</a><div class="slideshow-stats SlideshowStats_root__EQOR1 RailCard_stats__ZvZms"> </div><span aria-hidden="true" class="seo-only">In 2025, cross-border data transfers are becoming harder to manage—not because there are no rules, the regulatory environment has become increasingly complex. Legal obligations vary by jurisdiction, and risk factors include national security, AI, and vendor exposure. Some of the examples of the recent developments that are reshaping how organizations must approach transfer governance:

- The U.S. DOJ’s new rule restricts the outbound transfer of sensitive personal data to foreign adversaries countries of concern, introducing national security-based exposure that privacy teams must now assess.
​​- The EDPB confirmed that GDPR applies to AI model training — meaning any model trained on EU personal data, regardless of location, must meet lawful processing and cross-border transfer standards.
- Recent enforcement — such as a €290 million GDPR fine against Uber for unlawful transfers and a €30.5 million fine against Clearview AI for scraping biometric data signals growing regulatory intolerance for cross-border data misuse, especially when transparency and lawful basis are lacking.
- Gartner forecasts that by 2027, over 40% of AI-related privacy violations will result from unintended cross-border data exposure via GenAI tools.

Together, these developments reflect a new era of privacy risk: not just legal exposure—but operational fragility. Privacy programs must/can now defend transfers at the system, vendor, and use-case level—with documentation, certification, and proactive governance.

The session blends policy/regulatory events and risk framing with practical enablement, using these developments to explain how TrustArc’s Data Mapping &amp; Risk Manager, Assessment Manager and Assurance Services help organizations build defensible, scalable cross-border data transfer programs.

This webinar is eligible for 1 CPE credit.</span></div></div><div class="" id=":R936k7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="bottom-start" style="position-anchor:--popover-R936k7d6"></div><div class="separator Separator_root__70Ime Separator_horizontal__czVEa" style="--color:var(--blue-gray-200);--size:1px" role="separator"></div><div class="RailCard_root__rZUGY RailCard_hasDescription__MjSgf SlideshowCard_root__pD8t4 slideshow-card" aria-describedby="latest-card-description-4" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":R9b6k7d6:" popovertarget=":R9b6k7d6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-R9b6k7d6"><a class="SlideshowCardLink_root__p8KI7" data-cy="slideshow-card-link" data-testid="slideshow-card-link" href="https://www.slideshare.net/slideshow/cloudstack-euug-may-2025-introduction-101-giles-sirett-pdf/279333961"><span class="sr-only">Apache CloudStack 101 - Introduction, What’s New and What’s Coming</span></a><div class="slideshow-thumbnail Thumbnail_root__qLW0K SlideshowCard_thumb__86aJk" style="aspect-ratio:1.5;--index:4" data-testid="card-thumbnail"><img class="Thumbnail_thumb__UXO3a Thumbnail_blur__opK6A Thumbnail_cover__1zsIi" alt="Apache CloudStack 101 - Introduction, What’s New and What’s Coming" src="https://cdn.slidesharecdn.com/ss_thumbnails/cloudstackeuug-may2025-introduction101-gilessirett-250519110813-abe700f1-thumbnail.jpg?width=560&amp;fit=bounds" loading="lazy"/><img class="Thumbnail_thumb__UXO3a Thumbnail_contain__K6M0d" alt="Apache CloudStack 101 - Introduction, What’s New and What’s Coming" src="https://cdn.slidesharecdn.com/ss_thumbnails/cloudstackeuug-may2025-introduction101-gilessirett-250519110813-abe700f1-thumbnail.jpg?width=560&amp;fit=bounds" loading="lazy"/></div><div class="SlideshowCard_content__xh7kV slideshow-card-content"><span class="slideshow-title SlideshowTitle_root__2VccW RailCard_title__Tvfiv ellipsis" style="-webkit-line-clamp:2" data-cy="slideshow-title">Apache CloudStack 101 - Introduction, What’s New and What’s Coming</span><button type="button" class="Button_root__i1yp0 Button_secondary__hHiHI Button_text__ZT_3O Button_small__sqsEx Button_icon__1C4qi save-slideshow-button SaveButton_root__b6zuu" data-testid="button" aria-checked="false" aria-label="Save Apache CloudStack 101 - Introduction, What’s New and What’s Coming for later" role="switch" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":R2r9b6k7d6:" popovertarget=":R2r9b6k7d6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-R2r9b6k7d6"><span class="icon Icon_root__AjZyv" style="--size:24px"><span class="Icon_icon__4zzsG" style="mask-image:url(https://public.slidesharecdn.com/_next/static/media/save.ef1812e2.svg);background-color:currentColor"></span><span class="sr-only"></span></span></button><div class="Tooltip_root__7FS0Y" id=":R2r9b6k7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="top" style="position-anchor:--popover-R2r9b6k7d6"></div><a class="SlideshowAuthor_root__IkT1_ RailCard_author__JYeYZ slideshow-author ellipsis" data-testid="slideshow-author" data-cy="slideshow-author" href="https://www.slideshare.net/ShapeBlue">ShapeBlue</a><div class="slideshow-stats SlideshowStats_root__EQOR1 RailCard_stats__ZvZms"> </div><span aria-hidden="true" class="seo-only">This session provided an introductory overview of CloudStack, covering its core features, architecture, and practical use cases. Attendees gained insights into how CloudStack simplifies cloud orchestration, supports multiple hypervisors, and integrates seamlessly with existing IT infrastructures.

--

The CloudStack European User Group 2025 took place on May 8th in Vienna, Austria. The event once again brought together open-source cloud professionals, contributors, developers, and users for a day of deep technical insights, knowledge sharing, and community connection.</span></div></div><div class="" id=":R9b6k7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="bottom-start" style="position-anchor:--popover-R9b6k7d6"></div><div class="separator Separator_root__70Ime Separator_horizontal__czVEa" style="--color:var(--blue-gray-200);--size:1px" role="separator"></div><div class="RailCard_root__rZUGY RailCard_hasDescription__MjSgf SlideshowCard_root__pD8t4 slideshow-card" aria-describedby="latest-card-description-5" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":R9j6k7d6:" popovertarget=":R9j6k7d6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-R9j6k7d6"><a class="SlideshowCardLink_root__p8KI7" data-cy="slideshow-card-link" data-testid="slideshow-card-link" href="https://www.slideshare.net/slideshow/ai-in-java-mcp-in-action-langchain4j-cdi-smallrye-llm-spring-ai/279604190"><span class="sr-only">AI in Java - MCP in Action, Langchain4J-CDI, SmallRye-LLM, Spring AI</span></a><div class="slideshow-thumbnail Thumbnail_root__qLW0K SlideshowCard_thumb__86aJk" style="aspect-ratio:1.5;--index:5" data-testid="card-thumbnail"><img class="Thumbnail_thumb__UXO3a Thumbnail_blur__opK6A Thumbnail_cover__1zsIi" alt="AI in Java - RailCard_stats__ZvZms"> </div><span aria-hidden="true" class="seo-only">DIMSI showcased a proposed feature to help CloudStack users capitalize on cloud usage metrics out of the box. Gregoire Lamodiere and Joffrey Luangsaysana explored the need for improved visibility into cloud consumption metrics for both administrators and end users. They invited input and insights from the Apache CloudStack community regarding the proposal, fostering collaborative dialogue to refine the feature and ensure it meets the community&#x27;s needs.

--

The CloudStack European User Group 2025 took place on May 8th in Vienna, Austria. The event once again brought together open-source cloud professionals, contributors, developers, and users for a day of deep technical insights, knowledge sharing, and community connection.</span></div></div><div class="" id=":Rab6k7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="bottom-start" style="position-anchor:--popover-Rab6k7d6"></div><div class="separator Separator_root__70Ime Separator_horizontal__czVEa" style="--color:var(--blue-gray-200);--size:1px" role="separator"></div><div class="RailCard_root__rZUGY RailCard_hasDescription__MjSgf SlideshowCard_root__pD8t4 slideshow-card" aria-describedby="latest-card-description-9" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":Raj6k7d6:" popovertarget=":Raj6k7d6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-Raj6k7d6"><a class="SlideshowCardLink_root__p8KI7" data-cy="slideshow-card-link" data-testid="slideshow-card-link" href="https://www.slideshare.net/slideshow/ai-unboxed-how-to-approach-ai-for-maximum-return/279389394"><span class="sr-only">AI Unboxed - How to Approach AI for Maximum Return</span></a><div class="slideshow-thumbnail Thumbnail_root__qLW0K SlideshowCard_thumb__86aJk" style="aspect-ratio:1.5;--index:9" data-testid="card-thumbnail"><img class="Thumbnail_thumb__UXO3a Thumbnail_blur__opK6A Thumbnail_cover__1zsIi" alt="AI Unboxed - How to Approach AI for Maximum Return" src="https://cdn.slidesharecdn.com/ss_thumbnails/mereldaxschauenberg-aiunboxedexport-250520082644-d94599ce-thumbnail.jpg?width=560&amp;fit=bounds" loading="lazy"/><img class="Thumbnail_thumb__UXO3a Thumbnail_contain__K6M0d" alt="AI Unboxed - How to Approach AI for Maximum Return" src="https://cdn.slidesharecdn.com/ss_thumbnails/mereldaxschauenberg-aiunboxedexport-250520082644-d94599ce-thumbnail.jpg?width=560&amp;fit=bounds" loading="lazy"/></div><div class="SlideshowCard_content__xh7kV slideshow-card-content"><span class="slideshow-title SlideshowTitle_root__2VccW RailCard_title__Tvfiv ellipsis" style="-webkit-line-clamp:2" data-cy="slideshow-title">AI Unboxed - How to Approach AI for Maximum Return</span><button type="button" class="Button_root__i1yp0 Button_secondary__hHiHI Button_text__ZT_3O Button_small__sqsEx Button_icon__1C4qi save-slideshow-button SaveButton_root__b6zuu" data-testid="button" aria-checked="false" aria-label="Save AI Unboxed - How to Approach AI for Maximum Return for later" role="switch" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":R2raj6k7d6:" popovertarget=":R2raj6k7d6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-R2raj6k7d6"><span class="icon Icon_root__AjZyv" style="--size:24px"><span class="Icon_icon__4zzsG" style="mask-image:url(https://public.slidesharecdn.com/_next/static/media/save.ef1812e2.svg);background-color:currentColor"></span><span class="sr-only"></span></span></button><div class="Tooltip_root__7FS0Y" id=":R2raj6k7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="top" style="position-anchor:--popover-R2raj6k7d6"></div><a class="SlideshowAuthor_root__IkT1_ RailCard_author__JYeYZ slideshow-author ellipsis" data-testid="slideshow-author" data-cy="slideshow-author" href="https://www.slideshare.net/Merelda">Merelda</a><div class="slideshow-stats SlideshowStats_root__EQOR1 RailCard_stats__ZvZms"> </div><span aria-hidden="true" class="seo-only">Keynote for a client. 

In this session, Merelda addressed common misconceptions about AI technologies, particularly the confusion between Predictive AI and Generative AI, and provided clarity on when to use each. Predictive AI analyzes historical data to forecast future outcomes, while Generative AI creates new content, from text to images, rapidly. Understanding the differences between these technologies is crucial for making informed, strategic decisions.

She introduced the three archetypes of AI adoption: Takers, Shapers, and Makers, inviting the audience to identify which role their organisation plays. Based on these archetypes, she presented industry-specific examples relevant to Schauenburg’s portfolio, showcasing how Predictive AI can drive operational efficiency (e.g., predicting equipment maintenance), while Generative AI enhances customer interactions (e.g., generating technical documents).

The session received a 10/10 rating from attendees for its practical insights and immediate applicability.</span></div></div><div class="" id=":Raj6k7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="bottom-start" style="position-anchor:--popover-Raj6k7d6"></div><div class="separator Separator_root__70Ime Separator_horizontal__czVEa" in Team Topologies</span><button type="button" class="Button_root__i1yp0 Button_secondary__hHiHI Button_text__ZT_3O Button_small__sqsEx Button_icon__1C4qi save-slideshow-button SaveButton_root__b6zuu" class="Tooltip_root__7FS0Y" id=":R2rar6k7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="top" style="position-anchor:--popover-R2rar6k7d6"></div><a class="SlideshowAuthor_root__IkT1_ RailCard_author__JYeYZ SlideshowStats_root__EQOR1 RailCard_stats__ZvZms"> </div><span aria-hidden="true" class="seo-only">In this talk I will break down the argument presented in the book and argue that it is fundamentally ill-conceived, building on weak and erroneous assumptions. And that this leads to a &quot;solution&quot; that is not only flawed, but outright wrong, and might cost your organization vast sums of money for far inferior results.</span></div></div><div class="" id=":Rar6k7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="bottom-start" style="position-anchor:--popover-Rar6k7d6"></div><div class="separator Separator_root__70Ime Separator_horizontal__czVEa" aria-describedby="latest-card-description-11" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":Rb36k7d6:" popovertarget=":Rb36k7d6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-Rb36k7d6"><a The deck covers key product capabilities, integration possibilities, use cases, and partner enablement resources to prepare sales and technical teams for effective customer engagement. Ideal for initial partner briefings, the document aims to align stakeholders on value propositions and foster collaboration for successful product adoption.

</span></div></div><div class="" id=":Rcj6k7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="bottom-start" style="position-anchor:--popover-Rcj6k7d6"></div><div class="separator Separator_root__70Ime Separator_horizontal__czVEa" style="--color:var(--blue-gray-200);--size:1px" role="separator"></div><div class="RailCard_root__rZUGY RailCard_hasDescription__MjSgf SlideshowCard_root__pD8t4 slideshow-card" aria-describedby="latest-card-description-18" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":Rcr6k7d6:" popovertarget=":Rcr6k7d6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-Rcr6k7d6"><a class="SlideshowCardLink_root__p8KI7" data-cy="slideshow-card-link" data-testid="slideshow-card-link" href="https://www.slideshare.net/slideshow/is-your-qa-team-still-working-in-silos-here-s-what-to-do/279384540"><span class="sr-only">Is Your QA Team Still Working in Silos? Here&#x27;s What to Do.</span></a><div class="slideshow-thumbnail Thumbnail_root__qLW0K SlideshowCard_thumb__86aJk" style="aspect-ratio:1.5;--index:18" data-testid="card-thumbnail"><img class="Thumbnail_thumb__UXO3a Thumbnail_blur__opK6A Thumbnail_cover__1zsIi" alt="Is Your QA Team Still Working in Silos? Here&#x27;s What to Do." src="https://cdn.slidesharecdn.com/ss_thumbnails/fbcarousal-250520064240-0feef23e-thumbnail.jpg?width=560&amp;fit=bounds" loading="lazy"/><img class="Thumbnail_thumb__UXO3a Thumbnail_contain__K6M0d" alt="Is Your QA Team Still Working in Silos? Here&#x27;s What to Do." src="https://cdn.slidesharecdn.com/ss_thumbnails/fbcarousal-250520064240-0feef23e-thumbnail.jpg?width=560&amp;fit=bounds" loading="lazy"/></div><div class="SlideshowCard_content__xh7kV slideshow-card-content"><span class="slideshow-title SlideshowTitle_root__2VccW RailCard_title__Tvfiv ellipsis" style="-webkit-line-clamp:2" data-cy="slideshow-title">Is Your QA Team Still Working in Silos? Here&#x27;s What to Do.</span><button type="button" class="Button_root__i1yp0 Button_secondary__hHiHI Button_text__ZT_3O Button_small__sqsEx Button_icon__1C4qi save-slideshow-button SaveButton_root__b6zuu" data-testid="button" aria-checked="false" aria-label="Save Is Your QA Team Still Working in Silos? Here&#x27;s What to Do. for later" role="switch" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":R2rcr6k7d6:" popovertarget=":R2rcr6k7d6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-R2rcr6k7d6"><span class="icon Icon_root__AjZyv" style="--size:24px"><span class="Icon_icon__4zzsG" style="mask-image:url(https://public.slidesharecdn.com/_next/static/media/save.ef1812e2.svg);background-color:currentColor"></span><span class="sr-only"></span></span></button><div class="Tooltip_root__7FS0Y" id=":R2rcr6k7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="top" style="position-anchor:--popover-R2rcr6k7d6"></div><a class="SlideshowAuthor_root__IkT1_ RailCard_author__JYeYZ slideshow-author ellipsis" data-testid="slideshow-author" data-cy="slideshow-author" href="https://www.slideshare.net/marketing943205">marketing943205</a><div class="slideshow-stats SlideshowStats_root__EQOR1 RailCard_stats__ZvZms"> </div><span aria-hidden="true" class="seo-only">Often, QA teams find themselves working in silos: the mobile team focused solely on app functionality, the web team on their portal, and API testers on their endpoints, with limited visibility into how these pieces truly connect. This separation can lead to missed integration bugs that only surface in production, causing frustrating customer experiences like order errors or payment failures. It can also mean duplicated efforts, communication gaps, and a slower overall release cycle for those innovative F&amp;B features everyone is waiting for. 

If this sounds familiar, you&#x27;re in the right place! The carousel below, &quot;Is Your QA Team Still Working in Silos?&quot;, visually explores these common pitfalls and their impact on F&amp;B quality. More importantly, it introduces a collaborative, unified approach with Qyrus, showing how an all-in-one testing platform can help you break down these barriers, test end-to-end workflows seamlessly, and become a champion for comprehensive quality in your F&amp;B projects. Dive in to see how you can help deliver a five-star digital experience, every time! </span></div></div><div class="" id=":Rcr6k7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="bottom-start" style="position-anchor:--popover-Rcr6k7d6"></div><div class="separator Separator_root__70Ime Separator_horizontal__czVEa" style="--color:var(--blue-gray-200);--size:1px" role="separator"></div><div  </li></div><div><li>23. <a class="Transcript_link__MLbGS" href="https://www.slideshare.net/slideshow/10-years-of-targeted-credential-phishing-billy-leonard/83684578#23">Threat Analysis Group
SMS </a> Interception.
 </li></div><div><li>24. <a class="Transcript_link__MLbGS" href="https://www.slideshare.net/slideshow/10-years-of-targeted-credential-phishing-billy-leonard/83684578#24">Threat Analysis Group
 </a> </li></div><div><li>25. <a class="Transcript_link__MLbGS" href="https://www.slideshare.net/slideshow/10-years-of-targeted-credential-phishing-billy-leonard/83684578#25">Threat Analysis Group </a> Source: https://techcrunch.com/2016/07/25/nist-declares-the-age-of-sms-based-2-factor-authentication-over/,

Security </a> Keys.

00:22:50 UTC","description":"While it's not kernel 0days or EMET bypasses, credential phishing has been a go-to in attackers toolboxes for many years, rising to prominence during the run up to the 2016 US Presidential Elections. Being able to access a target's email or files stored in the cloud without burning your prized 0day has proven to be too much for even the most advanced attackers to pass up. In this talk, we will look at how attackers have evolved and adapted their credential phishing operations over the past 10 years, from changes in delivery mechanisms to changes in persistence and exfiltration and how defenses have evolved during that same time. It serves as the fortress safeguarding an organization’s critical resources from potential breaches and insider threats. However, within this stronghold lies a crucial yet often overlooked feature: session monitoring.\n\nSession monitoring within PAM involves the continuous surveillance and analysis of privileged user activities during their sessions. Typically involving administrators, IT personnel, and other users with elevated access to sensitive systems or data, these sessions provide valuable insights into user behavior, enabling organizations to detect anomalies and mitigate risks effectively.\n\nUnderstanding the Significance\n\nReal-time Threat Detection: Session monitoring enables real-time visibility into privileged user actions, allowing security teams to promptly identify suspicious activities such as unauthorized access attempts, unusual commands, and data exfiltration.\n\nCompliance Requirements: Adherence to stringent controls over privileged access is mandated by various regulatory standards like GDPR, HIPAA, and PCI DSS, which also require organizations to monitor and audit such activities. Session monitoring ensures compliance, shielding enterprises from hefty fines and penalties.\n\nInsider Threat Mitigation: Trusted insiders pose a significant risk to enterprises, regardless of their motives. Monitoring privileged sessions helps prevent data breaches and sabotage by detecting unusual behavior early on.\n\nForensic Analysis: Detailed session logs serve as invaluable forensic evidence in the unfortunate event of a security breach. Security teams can analyze these logs to determine the breach’s extent, identify its origin, and implement necessary corrective measures.\n\nImplementing Effective Session Monitoring\n\nComprehensive Logging: Enable thorough recording of all privileged user actions, including command executions, file accesses, and configuration changes, ensuring logs contain sufficient details for accurate session reconstruction.\nReal-time Alerts: Implement alerts to notify security teams of suspicious activities or deviations from normal user behavior.\nBehavioral Analytics: Utilize behavioral analytics to detect patterns indicative of potential security threats.\nSession Recording: Capture session activities in real-time for later review and analysis.\nAccess Controls: Implement strict access controls to limit who can monitor sessions and access session logs.\nChallenges and Considerations\n\nPrivacy Concerns: Balancing user privacy rights with the necessity of session tracking is crucial. Organizations must develop explicit policies governing the collection, storage, and use of session data to ensure compliance with relevant privacy regulations.\nPerformance Impact: Session monitoring may impose overhead on systems and networks, particularly in environments with high privileged user activity. ","tags":["pam","privileged access","management"],"url":"https://www.slideshare.net/slideshow/strengthening-security-through-session-monitoring-in-privileged-access-management/269946069","userLogin":"bert308558","userName":"Bert Blevins","viewCount":36},{"algorithmId":"11","displayTitle":"Phishing 101: Part-2 Blog Welcome to this Phishing Blog Part2","isSavedByCurrentUser":false,"pageCount":10,"score":0.3076,"slideshowId":"276334866","sourceName":"cm_text_v2","strippedTitle":"phishing-101-part-2-blog-welcome-to-this-phishing-blog-part2","thumbnail":"https://cdn.slidesharecdn.com/ss_thumbnails/phishing101part-2-250306070752-0fd62530-thumbnail.jpg?width=600\u0026height=600\u0026fit=bounds","description":"Discover advanced phishing tactics, real-world cases, and top defenses.
